Reviews.Title: “If you want All work and no play...this is where you stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheGlamorousLife
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights because I found an exceptional weekend deal. The room I stayed in was just average at best. The hotel was filled with conferences and wedding events. Nothing exciting just a standard Fairmont. You must rent a car to get to anything exciting beyond work/business related activities. I was in town for a wedding so it served it's purpose quite well and I couldn't be the deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TexasDad1836
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expected from a Fairmont Hotel. Helpful, friendly staff. Beautiful, spacious suite (they had no rooms for common folk like me and had to upgrade me!). My only nit was some pipes (I guess) that were banging nearby (I was in Room 400). Not enough to keep me from sleeping, but would have been annoying had I stayed more than one night. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5-star with all the usual bells and whistles”
Reviews.Author: Bennelong
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here for some meetings. Perfectly nice place, slightly dated but well-equipped - wifi throughout (not free), good sized room with desk, large TV with lots of channels, ironing board / iron, decent bathroom....and ice machine on each floor - nice touch! Ok gym that's open 24/7, outdoor pool, good (but slightly over-priced) restaurant. Service appropriately slick all round. About 30 minutes drive from DFW. Would I stay again? Sure, but only on business, not for fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: ECtraveler12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in the South Tower. Ask for a quiet room and got a corner suite. Room is big and nice. Only complaint is the poor lighting in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a conference”
Reviews.Author: Pir8guy
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days here for a conference (which was held at the hotel). It's a nice place, probably a little older than some, but it seems to have been renovated over time to keep pretty high standards. The room was nice, pretty large, with a good work area/desk. Room service was kind of pricey, but the food was good. I ate at the bar a couple of times (the restaurant is really expensive) and a couple of items were outstanding (pork tacos and the cheese plate). I was there earlier in the week when the tornadoes ripped thru metro Dallas. Kudos to the hotel and it's staff for having a plan in place and for executing that plan for it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: W4ATL
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a nice historic hotel in the arts district of Dallas. I had a 2 queen bed room which was comfortable and not crowded. There was a separate area near the entrance to the room where the desk was to work with your laptop. The TV is Hi Def with most all of the channels in Hi def. The shower has a fully adjustable head so it can be adjusted for height. Tall or short people will have no problems with the shower. HVAC was quiet and worked well. The bar adjacent to the lobby is nice with 2 TVs on sports channels most of the time. The menu is limited if you want to eat their. Mostly burgers and sandwiches with a few salads. For a better meal the Pyramid restaurant next to the bar offers a high end dining experience but it is pricey. The food and service at Pyramid is great. There is a Starbucks located in the hotel if you want a less expensive breakfast or lunch. Internet works well but was over $15/day. I tried to wander around the hotel but there is not much around. The 2 restaurants I tried to go to were closed (it was a Sunday) plus there are a lot of Urban Outdoorsmen wandering around so I decided to stay close at the hotel for the remainder of my time here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a meeting space.”
Reviews.Author: ZMyers
Reviews.Content: All in all, a decent spot. Good room size... A/C did not work too well Tubs needed resurfacing/replacing. Lighting was good. Flat Panel TV. Slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best water situation...”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTexan
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the staff is excellent, but the hotel has some real problems. We couldn't get hot water so after a cold shower the first day, I called and complained. The man came and let the water run full blast in the tub and sink for five minutes and we finally got hot water. We had to do that every time. The AC wasn't cooling well at all although it was bearable. There were very load noises coming from the elevator that we could hear in our room all night. Not a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “The employees are amazing... the rest not so much!”
Reviews.Author: kdm311
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there two nights as part of our niece's wedding weekend. The employees are extremely helpful and polite. After the first night, we called to have them check the air conditioner which was not cooling. An employee came promptly, but it still did not work. I would choose another place to stay the next time we need downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Not the type of Fairmont I'm used to...”
Reviews.Author: PackLightTravelHeavy
Reviews.Content: I will caveat this post with: I am a Fairmont platinum member. I stay in a Fairmont very regularly. But I have never stayed in this particular one before. The parking is all valet - a great convenience, unless you have to unpack your car, which has to be done in front of everyone in the lobby. Check-in was easy and nice, and they are great about allowing dogs. The hotel, room, bathroom was very...tired. I just think this Fairmont is in need of a facelift. We stayed in a suite, which was large, but it just had an "old" feeling to it. They really need to do an upgrade to this hotel and restore it to its previous grandeur. I remember coming to brunch here as a kid, and it being the nicest hotel around. It's still nice, but not the immaculate, to-the-nines Fairmont that I am used to staying in all the time (DC). We did have some issues with their service (they made me chase down people in the lobby and then the bar to get a corkscrew), but the manager rectified the situation upon checkout and was very professional about the issue. It did not color our stay at all, given the response from the staff. Overall, decent if you can get a good rate, but I wouldn't pay full freight for this property. Stay at the new W in Dallas instead!

Reviews.Title: “Constant Disappointments”
Reviews.Author: CDNPrairieGal
Reviews.Content: I would first like to begin by saying that I am a dedicated fan of the Fairmont brand-and it is not just because I am a Canadian. I have stayed at Fairmonts around the world. As I type this, it is with the background of being a fan and the sadness that this was the worst stay I have ever had at a Fairmont. I struggled with the thought of not posting this, because it may taint the Fairmont brand, but rethought since I feel this site deserves honesty. I stayed at this hotel for a week over Christmas. I was first escorted up to my room by a very nice bellman, JD. The ice machine outside my room was broken and the whole hallway smelled of must/mould. The fan used in the hallway to clear/dry up the leak was very loud and could be heard through my room door. Although the suite was a recently renovated space and as lovely as it was, it was as if someone had stopped renovating/decorating it right before the last of the finishing touches were done. There was one phone in the whole suite, no lamp on the phone table in the living area, toiletries were incomplete and the musty smell was intolerable. I asked for another room. When JD moved me again, I have to say, I was exhausted from my trip-I had been up 36 hours by this time and I just wanted to go to sleep. This was not easy-my new room,1201 had: a leaky tub faucet ( I had to close the door to not hear it) a torn arm chair arm no recycling basket the note pad stuck to a spill on the end table which also was missing the finish in several places the garbage was missing in the bedroom there was a paint chip missing out of the door at eye level the toiletries were mixed up (no lotion but 2 body washes) I was ill on the on the second day of my stay, so I did not want people coming in and out of my room. I called down later to let the front desk know of the tap and the end table issues only, because at that point, I had not seen the other problems. When I returned later to my room the third day, I saw that none of the issues had been dealt with. In addition, I then saw the torn chair arm. I had a friend coming to visit me and I had been bragging on the Fairmont chain; this was embarrassing. I asked for a new room and came to be in 1600. Daniel was excellent in helping me move-very kind and professional. He is proud to work for the chain. I began to feel better about my Fairmont brand. He helped me set up-again. Whenever he saw me, he always said hi and asked if he could be of service. I looked around my new suite and found that the end table was also missing several chunks of finish and had black stains on it. I asked for a new table-for two days. It never came. The TV in the bedroom had no cable but was eventually fixed. The toiletries were mixed-Miller Harris with their new brand. I never knew if I would find small bottled water in this room or not. In the other room (1201) there were always several bottles-very inconsistent housekeeping. The portable phone by the bed did not work nor did the remote control for the TV in the living room. I asked for them both to be dealt with- the remote was but the portable phone still did not work. I let Royal service know and said that could be addressed tomorrow. Later that night, a manager and a maintenance fellow showed up with a new phone. I said I could live without it for the evening and was getting ready for bed, could they come back tomorrow? I did appreciate the fruit tray sent to 1600, but housekeeping left it in the room for 3 days and things were beginning to mould. I left the lid off the tray to indicate removal-but I guess I needed to put a note on it for it to be taken away. I am assuming the tray was an apology? I called down to find out why it was in my room, but the clerk didn't seem to know why. I can say the food and the fellow who delivered the room service were great as were all of the valet staff. Sadly, the rest of my stay did not match. When I let management know, they apologized by email and offered me one free future night in a suite -for the whole week of issues and having had to move three times in said week. In my many Fairmont experiences, this hotel is NOT up to the brand name or attention to detail or quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “The maids steal and the food sucks”
Reviews.Author: FairmontSucks4
Reviews.Content: I am from Dallas and have been to all of the nicer hotels downtown for business... Was recently at the fairmont for a 3 day regional sales meeting. The food was poor, okay to say the least. The valet service and check in were below average, slow and unprepared. Also, items were stolen out of the room that they claimed to be unresponsible for. If I left it in the room, and then it was gone, they didn't take responsibility for their staffs actions at all. Very poor service and accommodations for the level this hotel is perceived to be at. Cool banquet rooms but I will be disappointed if our company holds another meeting of this magnitude there. We all missed the Westin Hotel very much, but they couldn't accommodate the number of people we had attending. Sadly to say neither could the fairmont. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the museums”
Reviews.Author: Albiart
Reviews.Content: Nice upscale hotel very close to the museum district - I'd give it 3 & a half stars if I could. I was in Dallas to see the Caravaggio show at the Kimbell Museum in Fort Worth but we also went to the Dallas Museum of Art, Crow Collection of Asian art & Nasher Sculpture Museum, all of which were easy walking distance from the Fairmont. I asked the concierge how to get to the Kimbell on public transportation & he sent me a few blocks away to the bus station - apparently no one had ever asked such a thing before in Texas's car culture. (It was relatively easy to do, although the trains & buses do NOT run on Sundays!!) The room was very nice & the gym was fine, but for the price we paid breakfast & wifi would have been nice. The neighborhood is not that great - kind of deserted & seedy on weekends. We ate dinner in the bar both nights as there were no local restaurants that looked vegetarian-friendly - tasty food & cocktails, not too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in the City”
Reviews.Author: jemandrews
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Dallas at the Fairmont with our kids. It is a good hotel for the price (which is pricey). They do not have an indoor pool which we had hoped by the outdoor pool was open and heated. We got in (despite the February chill) and thankfully it decent weather but chilly! Wish they had a hot tub on the terrace so you could get in and warm up. We had a good experience with the service, our room was clean and comfortable (but two double beds were small - wish they were queens). The hotel was really busy with multiple groups/events including a ton of cheerleaders - but we never had an issue with noise in our room. The lobby was a bit crazy at some points but we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all around”
Reviews.Author: RaginCajunCuisine
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the bed was extremely comfortable. Great view of the AA Center. Was in room 1409 on Feb 19-21. Valet was extremely friendly and the cocktail waitress named Tiffany was hilarious, nice, and a great addition to the lounge. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: MJPourpak
Reviews.Content: I normally really like Fairmont properties, but I found this one to be a bit unremarkable. The rooms seemed incredibly tired and in need of some refurnishing. The service was only so-so.... in fact, I was a bit put off by how the concierge started examining my luggage which was on a luggage cart (waiting for the bell boy to take it to the room) and when I asked him what he was doing he said he was just trying to see who I was. It seemed incredibly improper. The staff at the restaurant was cold/unprofessional. The food was OK, but not amazing. I don't know Dallas well but I'm sure you can find a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is bar none!!!”
Reviews.Author: Penny39
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my husband & I for Valentine's. Before our visit I arranged with Phillip in the concierge dept an in room massage for my husband and I. He was also very helpful with other information. We arrived and were treated like royalty! Very helpful staff & friendly! The hotel is aged a little but the customer service makes up for it hands down!! The bed was very comfortable & the liens soft. Room was very clean. The only issue I had was that the massage therapist named Sarah tried to cheat me on my 90 min massage but Phillip not only adjusted the different between the 60 massage I received but also took off the amount of the tip that I gave her plus more!!! He was one of the best concierge's I have ever had the privilege to work with. Everyone really cared to listen to me and made me feel very important. So the only suggestion I would recommend is that if you get an in room massage which is pricey but sooooo worth it, is to make sure the therapist can come up shortly before your schedule time and reenforce the time amount with the therapist. Check the time before & after. If they cheat you then take it up with them at that time. Also don't pay them directly charge it to your room so if you do have an issue with them the hotel can address it. Again I can not stress how great the customer service was, everyone from James at the bar which made the best mudslides I've ever had to the valet guys which had my car johnny on the spot to Phillip....I can't wait until we can go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Food, Tired Property, Discordant?”
Reviews.Author: Hobietim
Reviews.Content: A great Staff, obviously well trained and dedicated to service, food and service excellent, the physical property is ttired, TVs not working, noisy ventialtion and premises, very sad excersize facility. Overall a reasonable location, close to the trolley and tram, 8 blocks to convention center, i would not choose to stay here again until the physical property improves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, shame our stay wasnt longer”
Reviews.Author: Al b
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay in this hotel, we booked something that was a bit above average price so expected a decent hotel, and we were pleasantly suprised by the standard of the Fairmont. great customer service, lovely rooms, friendly staff. Also nice swimming pool and pool service. i got the feeling this predominantlly a hotel for businness men/women but there were also a fair amount of friend/families/couples there too. location very good, your in downtown dallas pretty much. only downer was the wifi wasnt free,but thats a minor and theres a free internet room in the lobby, unlimited internet if needed. The breakfast was perfectly cooked and the bar was nice to have a drink in the lobby. obviously there are cheaper options in dallas downtown but for the slight extra you seriouslly cant go wrong with this hotel, was worth paying the extra 30 or 40 bucks

Reviews.Title: “Loved the fairmont”
Reviews.Author: PrincetonBelle
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay and breakfast was phenomenal. Staff was very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very pleasant stay - service dedication is behind”
Reviews.Author: MexicoViva
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel is located in the artist center and is greatly reachable and only 25 min distance from the airport, almost downtown. We had a very pleasant stay, however, the service was somehow 'very professional' instead of warm and obliging.... We stayed for 4 days during the week and had a great suite at the executive level â€“ plenty of room for 2 persons. The highlight in the morning was the breakfast at the lounge at the 18th floor and I really enjoyed the choice of fruits, warm dishes and great coffee. The only thing missing for a really excellent stay: by spending 4 nights at the hotel, I would have expected that our towels might have been changed at least once (and there was no ecologic hint available in the bathroom) and that amenities like shower gel and body milk would have been replaced at some point in time. Instead I was frustrated by squeezing out the rest of itâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: texanroadtripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a lovely room on a high floor. The room itself was immaculate, the view was great, and the hotel itself was warm and well-appointed, with nice touches like excellent, non-glaring bathroom lighting and artwork in the lobby. The staff I encountered were uniformly efficient and kind, and I walked to all of my downtown business meetings. A few warnings: food and parking are pricey (half a grapefruit: $8; parking: $25/night), and avoid rooms by the ice machines, which are loud.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: TravelLib
Reviews.Content: This was a conference stay for me and as I'd booked late, there wasn't a lot of choice left for hotels near the Convention Center. I'd stayed at other Fairmont properties, so this seemed like a good choice. Fantastically comfortable bed. Housekeeping was good, but not great--it didn't look like anyone had really LOOKED at the room as the valance on the curtain was hanging off about 2 feet.. Concierge and bell staff were wonderful. The restaurant was very good, which was helpful since there isn't a lot nearby. All-in-all, the weekend stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sallad13
Reviews.Content: Went to Dallas on a business trip. Stayed at Fairmont, room was large, clean, it was fine. Over zealous maid threw out my unread newspaper...and I am still waiting for the management to call me back. After breakfast, I waited and waited to pay, and I had to track someone down to pay (apparently, my waiter was sent to lunch and no one picked up my table). Would I stay here again? Probably not...but as I said, it was clean and I felt safe. Beds were double rather than queen, and I wish it had a fridge, rather than the minibar... Would not stay here again, but rather the Magnolia Hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “eat somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: aphrab
Reviews.Content: Roomy, clean, but battered table in the sitting room. I paid $37 for room service of nachos and Coke. Absurdly pretentious, overpriced menu in the Pyramid Restaurant. Bar food lacks character--there's no Southwest item available. Poor bar service. My phone cut out regularly, requiring expensive redials. Engineer said stop using the phone. Low bathroom water pressure. Nice people take complaints but do nothing to help. For this price and this much annoyance, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JoeRFreitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a business trip in 2006. It is very well located and offers a very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: runner409
Reviews.Content: Typical but very good Fairmont amenities in a great location -1 block away from Dallas Museum of Art and with easy access to other downtown locations and freeways. At a business meeting- group food was ok but not outstanding. Attractive lobby bar. Fitness center in basement- no view but functional machines and weights. Interesting art in lobby and elsewhere in very nice building. Staff was uniformly helpful and pleasant. Internet access was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Furnishings dated, no spa”
Reviews.Author: divefan
Reviews.Content: I was in the South Tower, and as a Fairmont Premier member I should have been in one of their nicer rooms. Maybe the North Tower is nicer? The furnishings, carpet, drapes etc. were dated. The bathroom was small. The bathrobes were stiff and scratchy rather than soft and fluffy. My heating unit made noise the first night, but I was able to get it fixed the next day. I guess they're trying to be hip - they played rock with electric guitars at breakfast, which is not what I want to wake up to on a Sunday morning before I've had any coffee. On the plus side, it was a very short walk to the Dallas Museum of Art. There were a lot of staff around trying to be attentive. The bed had nice linens and was very comfortable. The price was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year”
Reviews.Author: simonbill1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several Fairmont properties across Canada, USA and were not surprised to find the Fairmont Dallas to be anything but your typical Fairmont deal. The building was ideally located in the arts district of Dallas. In easy walking distance from the rail system, Historic sites and the American Airlines Centre. The room was comfortable with plenty of storage space, we are used to a power shower and found the shower lacking, however the hotel is "green" so we did save water. Staff at the hotel were excellent. We arrived late having missed our connection from Atlanta and just wanted to go to bed. We have a smooth check in considering the place was alive with wedding parties. The breakfast buffet at $21 was okay, and you could order basically what you wanted. A good hotel in a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: powercat
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay while in Dallas. Everyone was very nice and rooms where great. Wish starbucks had better hours, but the people at the bar made some lattes for us when starbucks was closed. Great service

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at TravelZoo price”
Reviews.Author: robmcliberty
Reviews.Content: got 3 rooms and stayed with wife and 2 daughters and son in laws December 2010. Went to Mavs game. Fine room. Only surprise was valet parking at $20 a day.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont and State Fair”
Reviews.Author: brian62hill
Reviews.Content: Every year I make a pilgrimmage to Dallas Texas for the State Fair. If you love fairs, you must check out Dallas; it's like none other. It's set in beautiful Fair Park, the largest collection of Art Deco buildings in the US, built to commemorate Texas' Centennial in 1936. The architecture, landscaping, sculpture are all exquisite. Not to mention the Corny Dogs and the wonderful infectious sense of pride every Texan exhibits. It can be hard to find a hotel depending on when you go. This year, I stayed at the Fairmont, a favorite of Dallas' well-heeled set from Highland Park. Dripping in elegance (from the 70s), and conveniently located to the nearby Arts District. Fabulous views from the North Tower. Elegant lobby bar and professional staff. Taxis at the ready, or a few blocks to the DART. Large hotel, too, so if you want space in a large or not so large group, you're not on top of each other. Nicely appointed rooms. Could use a bit more housekeeping support - particularly for replenishing the rather cheap in-room coffee machine. Wi-Fi access. Quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Fairmont Gold”
Reviews.Author: GJ123
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 2 night stay at Fairmont. We got a good deal on the Fairmont Gold level room, and absolutely loved it. I would not stay without the Gold level because you get such great amenities in the lounge. We had breakfast (hot and cold), snacks, and desserts available every night. Loved the cappucino machine!! The people were all so very nice and provided everything we asked for with no problems, even allowing for late check out to let us enjoy the aquarium on the last day. It turned out that we needed a late check out because our daughter got "pooped on" standing below a bird at the aquarium, and needed a shower after we got back. Thank you for that! The only slight complaint that I had was the there was a stain on the carpet in the room, and it was obvious to see, which took away from the luxury feel. Other than that, I loved the slippers, potpouri in the closet, umbrella (just in case), robes, thick towels, rain shower, and the nice smelling lotion!

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jara C
Reviews.Content: I will try to make this as short as possible. My husband and I, on a budget, thought that this hotel looked really nice online, the price was nice, so we figured why not! When we arrived we found out they had MANDATORY valet parking (which yes is very nice and convenient, but NOT when you didn't budget for it!) This service at a whopping 26$ a day, took a little chunk out of our spending money. (Nowhere on their website or Orbitz did I see this information) Next, we brought our dog, which the hotel so nicely accepted. Surprise! There was a 25$ a DAY fee for that too! Another chunk out of our spending money. (Once again NEVER mentioned) After checking in, yes this hotel is BEAUTIFUL. But I was very disappointed with our room. It was very small. I have had much bigger hotel rooms for the price. When we walked in our hotel room was very warm and stuffy. We immediately turned the AC on and turned it down low. (Yes it's cold weather outside, but we like to stay cool and snuggle in blankets). After leaving for a few hours, then coming back, our room was still super stuffy! We called the front desk and they sent someone to fix it. He came up, "fixed it" and left. Let's just skip forward about 2 hours, after they showed us 3 other rooms, tried to fix it again, to finally the front desk calls us and says the AC is completely turned off in the wintertime. TURNED OFF. They said they could give us a box fan. And move us down a few floors, maybe it will be cooler. A BOX FAN. So we sat in our small hotel room with a dusty box fan from maintenance. On a side note, when we moved rooms, since we packed up in a hurry, we had accidently grabbed the remote from the first room. When we realized it, we took it down to the front desk and told them about the mix up. Later we checked our bank, they had already charged us for that remote!! They had just issued a credit. We were still in the hotel and they didn't even ask, they just charged us. Also, that's about the time we noticed they had put a $150 hold on our account for "just in case". Now seriously, I understand this is a fancy hotel. I just wish all these crazy fees would have been listed!! Through all of these unknown fees, we ended up paying about 60$ a night MORE than we originally bought. We will never stay here again, no one could give us a straight answer and they did nothing to help us with the AC. Our stay was terrible all because of this hotel. We were so stressed out from not knowing what we were going to find out next that we are now glad to be home, and having to relax from taking our VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Landrysmom
Reviews.Content: Too short a visit but great staff, accommodations, service. Will choose Fairmont next time in Dallas! Easily accommodated family of 4 with 2 adjoining rooms. Join the President's club for free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: 2Traveller2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times on business. From the moment you arrive, the staff are excellent, especially the room service staff. The hotel is big, but comfortable. It is close to most downtown locations, so you can walk from the hotel to where you need to be, but I'd feel uncomfortable walking to/from the hotel late at night. I have to point out that the room service is excellent, especially for a hotel in this part of the country. They have surprisingly healthy options on the menu, which are really tasty. As I mentioned before, the room service staff is really top notch. The rooms are what you'd expect from a Fairmont, though avoid the ones by the swimming pool during the summer where there are often kids out late at night. Cleanliness is a major factor for me, and this hotel was very clean and well-kept. Unless you or your company wants to pay for the Ritz Carlton, this is the only hotel to stay at in Downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Simmonsgirl1961
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont Dallas was everything I expect in a top-level hotel. The amenities provided on the Gold Floor were impeccably presented, the atmosphere ideal for adults seeking quiet elegance and convenience. I must commend the entire hotel staff for their gracious and efficient manner. The restaurant was also a delicious and delightful experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel In An Arty Area”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Dallas is Texas big with two tall towers and a lengthy lobby. Originally built as residential development, the property was converted to a hotel. Architecture and interior decor buff will larger concrete overhangs in place of balconies. Right in the midst of Dallasâ€™ mod Arts District, you can walk to any the AT&T Performing Arts Center theaters or museums. If you have time, do this. The buildings are architecturally impressive. In the opposite direction find casual restaurants in the Old Town, or a more NYC- feel near Neiman Marcus. Like most hotels, some rooms are renovated, some are not. All rooms are spacious. Renovated rooms have granite surfaces, sliding glass doors, fresh wallpaper and paint. The bath products are in the midst of being converted from Miller Harris to Le Labo, Fairmontâ€™s new bath amenities provider. Le Labo products have a nice consistency with a faint---almost unisex---rose smell. Based on interactions with the front desk, housekeeping and maintenance, the service was mostly excellent aside from an off night we had in the Pyramid Lobby Bar {where we had to ask to be served etc...}, and a concierge who was earnest and helpful, but a little glass half-empty. Perhaps isolated experiences? All in all, I would stay at the Fairmont Dallas again if I return to Dallas because of my Fairmont loyalty and points accrual. The hotel is EXCELLENT value {in comparison to other fairmonts and upscale hotels} for the price point paid. WHAT TO KNOW - free wifi if you join the Fairmont Presidentâ€™s Club {the hotel groupâ€™s free loyalty program] - there is no shopping mall within walking distance, the closest is NorthPark Center, located a $25 cab ride from the hotel - Thereâ€™s a Starbucks in the lobby - Highly recommend: The Nasher Sculpture Center and Dallas Museum of Arts - Also recommend Private Social Restaurant, a 7-min drive away - If the gold floor upgrade is available at the time you purchase the room, I felt it was good value---the best value Iâ€™ve seen at any Fairmont, and Iâ€™ve stayed at close to 25 worldwide. - The Fairmont gold staff are incredibly helpful and having what feels like your â€˜living roomâ€™ at a hotel makes for a more pleasant travel experience. - The city, mostly office buildings and not much residential, is pretty quiet on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - Gold lounge is a must!”
Reviews.Author: Emma N
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here with another couple, at the end of September. We had spent just over a week travelling around Texas and this was our last stop for 2 nights before flying home. We booked rooms which gave us access to the Gold Lounge as it meant some free food and free access to the internet, so we could book in online to our flight, but we could not recommend this hotel enough. The first day we got there, my friend and I went straight to the lounge while our other halves dropped the car back to the rental company. It was so nice to relax there after our hectic week. When the men came back we had a few drinks and the evening nibbles were served. We didn't need to get any dinner after this. We then went down to the pool as they were showing 'Ghostbusters' against a wall down by the pool. Picture quality was not as good as a cinema, but the sound was excellent and the whole experience was wonderful. We had a few cocktails and popcorn and there were some people dressed up as Ghostbusters as well. It was a great atmosphere! The rooms were very nice, our view was of a freeway and part of the city, looking towards the Hard Rock Cafe/Hooters area, but it also looked towards the setting sun and the sunset was beautiful. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable and huge. The Gold Lounge was the best thing about the stay though. You are told when you first enter that you should treat the lounge as an extension of your room. It includes a living room area on one side, with TV, books and internet access (1 terminal). On the other side are tables and the kitchen, which always has food available and drinks. Soft drinks are free, but alcohol is not, it is an honesty bar, so you write down what you have and your room number. The food served in the lounge was delicious, breakfast has a great selection and was very tasty. Once breakfast was finished there was tortilla soup and some other bits available, including sweet stuff, the tortilla soup was outstanding. In the evening there was hot and cold food, the first night included mini pots of macaroni cheese, that were so delicious, I think it had truffle oil in it - YUM! You can order food from the restaurant up to the Gold Lounge as you would to your room as well. The lounge is never over crowded as only 3 floors, which means about 30ish rooms have access to it and the 2 ladies who were looking after the lounge in the time we stayed there were so wonderful. I wish I could remember their names as they made our stay perfect. Thank you Fairmont Dallas, it was the perfect end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Service questionable”
Reviews.Author: Mec0415
Reviews.Content: I was truly looking forward to this hotel. Across the board I have never had a bad experiance with the Fairmont group and have always had a lovely time- but this was different. We checked in and the bellman (who was very friendly and nice) brought us to our room- except that it wasnt our room. I went to put my clothes away and someone's things were in the closet! We called down to the front desk right away and they moved us to another room but it was a bit bizzare- moreover, when the bellman came up to help us with our bags he left my briefcase in the other room- I should have been more aware admittedly but thankfully the women whose room we had disturbed brought it down to the front desk and said she had found this in her room... I wonder if they mentioned the mixup to her? Then we ordered breakfast the next morning and it didnt come even close to the time listed on our door hanger. My husband asked for his shoes to be shined and we requested that they be available at 8 am- they were done and looked wonderful- but it took two calls and an hour and a half to locate them. It just was not what I had expected from this hotel and it left me dissapointed. That being said, the hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very clean and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice for downtown”
Reviews.Author: txtvldude
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference at the Fairmont and was very impressed. Service was excellent, from the bellman upon arrival to them holding by bag during my conference after I checked out. Check in/check out were professional and quick. Rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service!”
Reviews.Author: Oklahoman71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Fairmont for the first time and would highly recommend it. It is a great location if you are going to a NHL game;close enough to walk. We booked on-line and stayed in a large suite for a very good rate. It is a pet friendly hotel and so were able to take our cat with us. The room was very nice and the room service was excellent for breakfast - we didn't have any other meals at the hotel. The location of the bar is unusual in that it is right off of the foyer and so you are not afforded any privacy. The bar food was so-so. What makes this a place that we look forward to going back to was the service. The staff know what they are doing and how to treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “I slept last night at the Fairmont Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: davidtevans
Reviews.Content: Considering what everything costs these days, we got a pretty good deal, at the last minute on a 17th floor corner room with a decent, but not spectacular view. I've stayed there once before, in a full size room, and the view is fantastic. This time it was a last minute bargain. I wish the mandatory valet did not cost $24 per night, but what can you do. A big wedding was going on, and that could explain the noisy neighbors, banging their door, in and out and I almost called the desk to complain. Luckily, the activity settled down. Very nice room, walking distance to very good food, and an added bonus...hot breakfast in the lounge on the 18th floor for gold level guests. Do not miss this. Tthe food and choices are excellent, and tit is complimentary. As in free. This would have cost at least $50 anywhere else. Impeccable and friendly service. A great hotel to stay in. Regret the weather was just a bit too coldto swim at the rooftop pool, which is wonderful on a nice day. Definitely recommend the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, dependable Dallas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Andaltex
Reviews.Content: As a former Dallas resident, I've had many opportunities to attend functions at the Fairmont and to stay at the hotel. My most recent visit was for a short weekend in the Dallas area. As usual, I was not disappointed. The room was in a quiet corner of the hotel, large, well appointed, and with a very nice bed and bathroom. The staff is pleasant and "on top of things". The only thing that keeps this review from being a "5" is the chronic valet parking issue at the hotel. 15 minutes before my departure, I attempted to call the valet desk, but there was no answer. When I arrived at the valet area, I had another 20 minute wait. The lady at the window was very pleasant and apologetic and appeared really hassled; there appeared to be only 3 valets attempting to serve many departing guests - a lot of whom were headed to "Jerry's World" for the Cowboy-Bills noon kickoff. I hope they made it...I arrived at my scheduled stop barely in time. In spite of that inconvenience, the Fairmont is a really nice hotel and often will have nicely discounted rates. Its downtown location and convenience to Uptown and the AAC are definite pluses. We'd be more that happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: bkosterski
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Dallas was a great location to historic downtown. I was there on a conference and was pleased to being staying at the host hotel. The outdoor pool was outstanding. As a 1st time visitor to Dallas the front desk, concierge and bellman were most helpful and friendly with all my questions along with giving directions and recommendations. The lobby bar was great as it was open and lively.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Brezzzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend. Booked through Fairmont's website a couple of months earlier and got a really great weekend deal by prepaying (cost was less than many suburban hotels/motels). The room was a double queen, which was huge with a living room area, big desk, floor to ceiling windows and a walk-in closet. The beds were very comfortable with lots of comfortable pillows. The lobby lounge was nicely busy and our waiter really knew his drinks. The Italian eggs benedict in the Pyramid dining room was incredible....fresh dill and basil...incredibly tasty. As per Fairmont's corporate policy, we were provided with free valet parking since we were driving a hybrid....a $24 a day saving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Coconut2011_4
Reviews.Content: Went for a business conference and our room was very nice. We had a corner room so the bathroom didn't just open directly onto the bedroom, but onto a small alcove with a built-in desk. Another wonderful feature, was the large walk-in closet. Room Serice was impeccable. In fact, everyone we encountered who worked at the hotel was great. For lunches during the busy convention, they had set up a quick-serve buffet which was a very nice added touch. The hotel is older, but has been beautifully updated. My only complaint was about the heating/AC. During our stay, Dallas experienced a massive cold front and we never could get our room to warm up after that. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Time to get it wrong, but not to get it right?”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyTrotFinisher
Reviews.Content: We previously stayed in the lovely Magnolia Dallas for the Turkey Trot, and it matched the Fairmont's special Trot price. This year, the Magnolia won't do that (even though we're long-time guests...but that's the next review I'm writing). So we contacted the Fairmont. Who first quoted a rate which was $30 higher than the special Trot rate they offer on the Trot website. Then agreed that OK, maybe they DID have a lower rate, after we showed them the Fairmont promo on the Trot page. When we expressed regret for the length of the call (keep in mind - it was THEIR ignorance of their own pricing that dragged things out), the rep said "Indeed I do have other customers to help." Well, OK, then consider yourself free to go help them. Because we won't be staying at the Fairmont. Now or ever. Rude. And either disingenous or uninformed about major event pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrid valet service”
Reviews.Author: suzym27
Reviews.Content: This is not the type of hotel that my husband and I typically choose. We were in Dallas for a family thing and decided to stay here since other family members were there. Nice place - but locked, crazy expensive, mini-fridge sort of place. Pros: Very friendly staff, clean rooms, every call we made (fan request, wake-up calls, etc) they were super friendly and accommodating. The coffee in the room was quite tasty - Newman's Own. Very comfortable beds (could have used a firmer pillow - but that is personal preference). Both nights we grabbed drinks at the bar the staff were very nice (even though they were out of a lot and the upholstery in the bar is in the most dire need of cleaning). Cons: When we checked in we asked for a good Mexican restaurant and we were directed to El Fenix. Turns out it is a local chain - and it is horrible. We did not ask for any other recommendations after that. The wait for your car at valet is RIDICULOUS (and there is no street parking for quick in-and-out trips). Yesterday, we went down at 10:40am and waited for 30 minutes for our car. We were told that we could call ahead of time, so the next day we did. Called down at 11ish to say we would like our car ready in 20 minutes. Went down, and they claimed they never got the call! Proceeded to wait 20 minutes for the car. Biggest annoyance to my husband was, rather than apologizing for the wait - the drivers just looked immediately to your hand. I am a generous tipper - but not when someone expects a tip regardless of service. People can smoke right outside the front doors - this results in the lobby smelling like an old cigar. Also, those of us waiting up to 30 minutes for our car get to hang out in a smokey area. Thanks Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay in Central Location...Just Okay Service”
Reviews.Author: ooHereandthereoo
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms and amenities at the Fairmont. The location is central to restaurants and businesses in the downtown Dallas area. Most restaurants are in walking distance (about .25 to .5 miles away) which can also be reached by cable cars that run on St. Paul. Internet access is also provided for free to club members (which is free). Restaurant and bar food and drinks were okay and we did not find it worth the price. We encountered a couple of issues with service. Our first issue was with the Bar. It took over 15 minutes before anyone came to take our order, then our server disappeared and it took us another 15 minutes to track down someone who was willing to help us. So we didn't have the opportunity to order additional drinks or food. Also, we noticed several inefficiencies with the valet service. Although it didn't impact me directly, I noticed that their disorganization caused significant back-ups in the valet and drive through area for the hotel which is already small to begin with. Be prepared to wait a while if you are looking to pull through during peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & well-located”
Reviews.Author: sheknits
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room & friendly, helpful staff. Easy access to Art Museum and free streetcar service both one block away. Enjoyed lunch in the lobby restaurant and the banquet department served an excellent BBQ brisket at a dinner reception. Meeting facilities were adequate for our meeting size, however, the ballroom used for exhibit space is poorly lighted. Walk across the street to the YMCA for a quick sandwich/salad/smoothie lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Bernerbaby
Reviews.Content: I had a fun weekend in Dallas; however, next time I travel there I would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, friendly staff, but the overnight shift needs help”
Reviews.Author: AndWhere2Next
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Dallas for a conference. Overall, the stay was pleasant and everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. One pleasant surprise was that the banquet food was better than I had expected. The rooms could use some updating but the bed was comfortable and the room was very well cleaned. My (insignificant) complaint was that it was very difficult to reach anyone at the front desk on the overnight shift on Saturday night. I had to walk downstairs at 2AM to have my question resolved. Other than that, I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmuseMeImBored
Reviews.Content: Just attended a conference at this hotel. Hotel room is nothing special for the price and could use some updating, and the bathroom is on the small side, but most important, the bed is very, very comfortable. Towels are nice and fluffy, and the drapes block sunlight/outside light nicely. Pyramid restaurant is quite expensive for the few bites of food served but what there was,was excellent. Extremely tender steak! Just tiny... especially considering it's Texas! The main conference rooms were convenient to the sub-conference rooms, and all were convenient to the hotel rooms. Elevators were fast with virtually no waiting. I would likely not choose to stay here for a personal retreat, but would certainly return for a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “valet/concierge(customer service) was their best asset”
Reviews.Author: Angi T
Reviews.Content: Ok the good list: Valet/concierge and room service customer service was outstanding! Location was ok, not much shopping in close proximity, bars/clubs are a $7 to $10 dollar cab ride one way. The room rate was a fair price. Yep thats the whole good list. Ok the bad list: I was not informed when I made res that there was a gay/lesbian convention goin on at the hotel, I have nothing against that but when your having a girls weekend away its not ideal! They took the lounge chairs and towels off the pool deck around 11 am to make way for the gay/lesbian party that was going on later which I could hear from my 17th floor room well into the night. The pool was bitter cold, there is no hot tub and half of the day the pool area is in the shade. Nobody came to take food or drink order poolside. When i found somebody and asked for towels and water they acted as if I was a bother. The room had no microwave or useable frige only a very expensive mini bar. The bathroom was extremely small, there are no balconies, the lounge bartenders were RUDE AS HECK! I dont see this being a four star hotel, just 4 star prices! I would not recommend this hotel nor will i ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: USA_Super_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel from Hotwire. All around, a very nice hotel. The lobby and bar area were very fancy and recently upgraded. The room itself was pretty regular, and didn't seem to be nearly as nice as the lobby would let on...but it was still a very nice room. But, it was clean, comfortable, and had a great view. Parking was a little steep at $24 per day, but it was valet service, and I'm not sure we could have found anything cheaper. Location was good, but not much within walking distance. All around, no complaints, and I would definitely consider staying here again when I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: We, as a company, have stayed at The Fairmont Dallas four consecutive years now for the TX/OU Red River Rivalry, which I imagine is one of the busiest weekend's of the year for the hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful through parking, checking in, and assistance over all. The rooms are always above par with cleanliness and amentities and the lobby bar has a great atmosphere for entertaining. We will recommend The Fairmont Dallas for any clients that need a place to stay and anytime we go for business. We look forward to our stay every year and wouldn't think of looking at another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Gold Standard”
Reviews.Author: D'sGirl
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my stay at the Fairmont. Everyone was so friendly and informative. I got in at 12:30AM thanks to a horrible experience with Super Shuttle. My room was on the "Gold Floor" this is worth the upgrade. Wonderful breakfast, nice atmosphere and a lovely hostess. The only thing they got wrong was my gender on my bill and gold letter. No biggie. I was treated wonderfully by everyone.

Reviews.Title: “An aging landmark”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a business conference held at this property. Although work has been done to spruce up the place, the rooms show their age. While my room was large and generally pretty clean, the carpet and furnishings were a bit tired. That said, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was clean with all the fixtures working as advertised. All the meals I had on property were in a group setting. The quality of the food was good. One thing that this Fairmont does well is service. Wherever I went and whatever I needed, the hotel staff were eager to please. It is clear outstanding service is an objective the hotel management strives to deliver. It was too pervasive to be the result of individual initiative.

Reviews.Title: “New home in Dallas...”
Reviews.Author: ngblackpearl
Reviews.Content: It is a pity,I only could stay 2 days in this magnificient place,I did not want to leave as I had a wonderful experience at The Fairmont.Everything was so nice.From checking in to checking out.I took the Gold room and the service was excellent.Nice,big room with all the confort. Private lounge for breakfast,tea time or evening cocktails.Donna and Darvet were absolutly wonderful .I had time to enjoy the Pool where you can enjoy nice food .The hotel is huge but you feel like home.Excellent location if you are here for business or holidays. I really recommand this fantastic place ...

Reviews.Title: “Calm under pressure”
Reviews.Author: MovinLew
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel last month. Although there were hundreds of participants, the front desk staff was calm and cool. As a frequent traveler, I appreciate that. Rooms were well kept and all amenities were stocked. Our room was much larger than I expected. The only thing that I don't like is that the valet is an extra $24/day. It should be half that, or at least discounted based on the number of nights one stays. I will certainly return - my car may not.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST SERVICE EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: julie d
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights celebrating my daughters 23rd bday. The service was fantastic. We upgraded to the gold floor where we had a suite and access to the the gold lounge. Donna, Jada and Darvet were fantastic. Great food and drinks through-out the day. They had flowers,champagne and cupcakes for my daughters bday. The front desk, the concierge(Phillip) the door guys (Tony) the bartenders were all fatntastic. We have never felt more celebrated and welcomed. The pool area is lovely. The bar is fun with big screen tv's. The location is great. close to trolly and downtown sightseeing. We cant wait to go back...would choose the Fairmont again for sure!! Thank you for a wonderful time and a great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, would come back”
Reviews.Author: kvyas
Reviews.Content: The stay was nice, hotel was good for the special price I got. The rooms were nice, nothing different from a nice marriott or Hilton. The parking is expensive and did not realize that cheaper options were not easily available until i got there. Didn't try the restaurants or bars

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: I10driver
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights and have no complaints. The staff were great. The rates were very reasonable. The room was clean and well appointed. The food was good. The pool was nice. Overall a really nice place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Service at its best”
Reviews.Author: Jayne L
Reviews.Content: Hotel fairmont Dallas was the light at the end of the tunnel after a long, exhausting flight from Australia. Service upon arrival was exceptional, and this trend continued throughout our stay. Breakfast a highlight in 'Pyramid' restaurant, where staff were pleasant, friendly and food on offer high quality. For those aussies that love value, good service, and the most comfortable sleep, this is the place. It is in the ' arts' district, so don't expect retail outlets in the vicinty, however a $20 cab ride will get you to ' Northpark' shopping centre, where every brand imaginable, plus Macys, neiman Marcus etc are at your disposal. All in all a great experience, and we look forward to our next stay in Dallas. Aussie hotels, lift your game!! This is the benchmark all hotels should aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “Higher end hotel at good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: We have normally stayed at the Ritz but they were sold out and went to the Fairmont Gold Level. Pricing at the Fairmont was very favorable compared to the Ritz. The rooms while small are very comfortable great bed and we did not hear any traffic noise. Service on Gold Level was excellent. One difference from other Gold Levels is the drinks are not included you pay via an honor bar. With that we did appreciate the water but I think next time we would forgo the Gold Level and upgrade to a suite for the same price. They offer breakfast and day time snacks in the Gold level which we did not use. Fitness room has a large number of cardio machines and limited weight equipment. Since no one else appeared to use the fitness room the limitation on weights and equipment did not prove to be a problem. Location while it initially does not look great turned out fantastic. We walked to the North End and a block away is the free street car that can take you to many of the restaurants and shopping. Room service was the only disappointment we had there. Free internet is available on Gold Level or for members of Presidents Club Over all while this is not the fanciest hotel in Dallas there is a very good price value here and the hotel is very clean and comfortable. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Renee S
Reviews.Content: The staff went above and beyond to make our stay Perfect! The rooms and pool are sparkling clean. The restaurant was good and the staff attentive. The concierge was the best we have ever found! We will always make the Fairmont our home when we visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't leave store your bags with them”
Reviews.Author: Kasia2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights, part business part pleasure. The hotel service, food, and conference facilities were great although there were some problems with keeping both the hotel rooms and conference rooms chilled enough. Since this is in the middle of a huge heat wave I would not blame the hotel. My problems came later, when I checked out and left my bags in storage. The operation seemed to be somewhat disorganized and against my better judgement I left without ensuring that my storage tickets were attached to my bags. Upon return my luggage could not be found. What ensued was 30 minutes of "deer in headlights" looks from hotel staff, including concierge, with very little explanation as to what was being done and what to expects if my bags could not be found. All I was told was that if my bags were found they would be shipped to me at no charge. Nobody said they were sorry for the inconvenience, gave me their name, business card, phone number so that I could follow up, etc. Throughout I had the feeling that everyone just wished I would go away. When I mentioned that I missed my airport shuttle I was told that I should just take the next one. When a woman from security took pity on me and put me in the cab she got evil looks from concierge as if she was doing something totally unacceptable. The good news was that just as I was about to leave for the airport without my bags, the shuttle driver returning from the airport arrived with the missing luggage. Apparently the hotel gave my bags to another hotel guest and loaded them on the airport shuttle. It was not until the guest arrived at the airport s/he realized that it was the wrong luggage. Hope the hotel shipped it to them at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel so great I want to live there!”
Reviews.Author: Firsthope
Reviews.Content: My recent and all too brief stay at the Fairmont Dallas was excellent! From the minute my cab pulled in and the bellman got my reservation started, to the time I checked out and had one last memorable conversation with Bellman Tony, I was enamored with the Fairmont. They certainly understand the concept of customer service, ensuring you are comfortable, and making you feel at home. My room was extremely spacious and well decorated. I didn't want to leave. The health club facilitites were clean, available 24 hours, complimentary to guests, and had an array of machines from which to choose. The business center was also complimentary to guests and it came in handy when a personal situation arose where I needed internet access. The food was wonderful; lobby atmosphere trendy and inviting. They have the most fabulous piece of art sculpture in front of the registration desk. My room was very quiet and my window views of Dallas were great by day and night. Staff were very friendly and helpful. A delightful visit...and very reasonable. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “A Classy Hotel but valet needs some work.”
Reviews.Author: interviewqueen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights over the weekend. It is a beautiful hotel and well polished, inside and out. I opted for the standard king, was on the 10th floor. The view was of downtown Dallas and it was beautiful. Our room was clean, the furniture was updated and even the night stand tables had granite tops. The entry into the hotel is also clean, and the service fantastic. Parking is available for 24 per night and all taxes, fees included unlike some of the other hotels. The valet available any time and the only complaint is that they do take about 15 mins to get your car. We were there the weekend they had an event and they said they had over 400 cars and for that reason they messed up pulling up my car. Because elf this our table at bolsa almost got given away. I had to ask to speak w the manager and after telling them we were waiting for 25 mins they told me they didn't know where my car was. They offered and paid for the cab. However that screwed up the rest of the nights plans as we were going to a show after dinner and I had to come back to hotel after dinner to get car. We missed the show. So just remember if they Have an event, you may have to wait for 30 mins for valet to bring your car. The neighborhood is near the arts district but nothing immediately next to it for bars/ nightlife. Walk about 6 blocks and it will get you to downtown Dallas where there are more bars. We did not get to use the pool or the exercise facilties. We were still happy for the rate we got and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in a Gold Room”
Reviews.Author: chingcm
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in we were upgraded to a Gold Room. The amenities are great if you're staying in a Gold Room. Free internet and fast. Free breakfast, hor d'oeuvres, and dessert. Beautiful room on the top floor with a great view of Downtown Dallas. Bathroom was updated and shower was great. Bed was so comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Pool area awesome”
Reviews.Author: mandmshow
Reviews.Content: Room had everything you could want for the price. It's not 5 star and does not pretend to be so if you are looking for that look elsewhere and pay more. Staff are very friendly and the food is good. Starbucks attached to hotel. The pool area is fantastic and gets plenty of sun. The pool very large and is 9 feet deep at one end. Pool area could just do with some cleaning attention (There are cigarette butts scattered around). Will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the gold club floors. Fantastic service and amenities. Internet worked great. Fantastic shower”
Reviews.Author: akasnowboard
Reviews.Content: Stay in the gold club floors. Fantastic service and amenities. Internet worked great. Fantastic shower.

Reviews.Title: “As 'hot' as Dallas in August!”
Reviews.Author: ciscokid23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Dallas Fairmont the weekend of August 5-7 for pleasure. A central downtown location - close to the Amtrak Union Station (a convenient and enjoyable way to get to Dallas if it fits your travel times and connections and your travel plans are flexible), the arts district (Dallas Museum of Art, the Nasher and the Crow collections), the West End entertainment district, the legendary downtown Neiman Marcus, etc., etc. - make for a convenient weekend getaway. The hotel, the facilities, and the personnel are all top notch. Special mention needs to be made of the breakfast hostess at the Pyramid Room - efficient, friendly, and remembered us from last year. Finally, the weekend rate for the Fairmont quality was a great value (go ahead, splurge on a two-room suite. I certainly did!). Stayed here last year, stayed again this year, and will probably return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good business location with fine amenities”
Reviews.Author: RollCaster
Reviews.Content: Can't miss the striking & imaginative horse sculpture in the lobby. Very friendly & helpful staff - everywhere. Nice, big guest room, comfortable bed, terrific shower head & nice bath towels, very quiet A/C. Bedroom floor - not completely clean. Good fitness center - not just treadmills. Breakfast and dinner charges for meals in the 1st floor restaurant were more expensive than the moderate room rate would lead you to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Comparable To The Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mjcco
Reviews.Content: They think of themselves as a Ritz or Four Seasons, but they are really a Marriott equivalent. The concierge can arrange champagne, but if you're hoping they will add you to any private club lists, forget it. Perfect location - located a few blocks from the McKinney Streetcar (St. Paul N of Ross) , which you can take to Perry's, Sambuca, the Ritz, Theater Three, West Village and the bars along McKinney. The Fairmont is a short cab ride from the Arts District (Wyly Theater, Winspear Opera House, Dallas Museum of Art, Nasher Sculpture Center and the AT&T Performing Arts Center. If you are older, a cab to Reunion Tower, Nieman Marcus, Iron Cactus, the Adolpho and the PM Lounge beneath the Joule Hotel are options. If you're 20-something, Zouk's, American Airlines Center and the Hotel W are not far away, not to mention RJ's Mexican Restaurant in the West End. The DART rail is 4.5 blocks south. This is a family-friendly hotel. I recommend the junior suite. Rates were very reasonable ($119 a night). Disappointed that we didn't have an iPOD stand and that refrigerators were extra. The pool was nice. They don't have a spa, so I recommend going to the Hilton Anatole for that. They don't have indoor tennis, so go to the Irving Four Seasons. The outdoor whirlpool needs to be a lot bigger and it would be nice if there were a water fall or something. The view is awesome. If you want a great hotel for your money, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: txninja
Reviews.Content: The service from the staff was excellent, the interior and exterior was very nice, the rooms were comfortable, and the lounge was adequate. We spent a lot of time on the terrace level while at the hotel where you had great views of downtown. The attendant was there, yet very busy with the larger groups. The gift shop was nice, yet pricey. The bar had some unique local brews on tap and the after sampling them both I grew quite fond of one. I'm not too keen on hotels that nickel and dime you for everything. As a previous reviewer mentioned, $7.50 for a bottle of water in your room is a bit outrageous. The internet access price of $15+ per day was a bit high as well. It was a running joke during our stay that everything we did at the hotel was going to cost us money. That being said, the location downtown was great. You had several attractions nearby and the trolley stopped a block away from the hotel which could take you to shops and restaurants. If it wasn't for the service and location, it would be hard to recommend this hotel just on face value.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Bad, Wasn't Great”
Reviews.Author: harleymomma74
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 30th and 31st with my husband and 2 kids ages 9 and 4. I have slept better at a La Quinta and so have they. Those that claim the beds at this hotel are wonderful must not know what a wonderful bed is. All I felt all night were springs in my back and each time my spouse moved, the bed rocked and jiggled. So we ended up with a kid in my double bed and a kid in his double bed. No better. Each of us moved so much to get comfortable that none of us got good sleep. It was a rough. Do not get breakfast here. Rip off to the max. Seriously? $20 for 3 pieces of bread and juice or coffee? Oh more if you want eggs.... and then they nickle and dime you for everything. Valet is $ but you get to come and go as you please with your ticket. So at least they only charge you once. The swimming pool was nice enough. Plenty of seating for the few who were at the pool. They keep a bar outside stocked ready to take your money, and towels on hand. Yes the place is very clean. They don't skimp on that as far as I could tell. Check in time is very crowded. Starbucks is downstairs. They use Keurig coffee makers so if you want to bring your creamer and Kcups then do it. I would have if I had known this ahead of time. I really loved seeing the garden on the deck level. The Pyramid Restaurant grows their herbs and some veggies and fruit there. It looked a bit bare and unkept but maybe it was because of seasonal things? I don't know for sure, I don't garden. But they have a greenhouse up there too. Pretty neat. Stick to business travel when using this hotel. Not really a family focused hotel at all. The double beds are just too small for two people, unless you are the size of a four year old.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Situation For Art Lovers”
Reviews.Author: ozscot
Reviews.Content: This 8 day visit was not my first at The Fairmont Dallas. It is within minutes walking distance from Dallas Art Museum, Nasher Sculture Garden ( my favourite ) and The Crow Asian Collection. You can walk to Union Station or spend a few taxi dollars to get there in order to visit Fort Worth and The Modern, Kimbell and Amon Carter. In the hotel itself the rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. Love the walk in wardrobe as it keeps the place tidy on an extended stay. The Pool Terrace has plenty seating both shaded and sunny and interesting herb and vegetable gardens on the same level. Staff recognize you from day one and are always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great club floor lounge - questionable air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: shellzj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one night business trip in July. Pros: The "Gold" club floor lounge is one of the best I've experienced. I normally stay at Starwood properties (Westin, Le Meridien, Sheraton). It's definitely better than almost all of the Westin/ Sheraton Lounges, and almost as good as what I've seen at Ritz Carlton. The afternoon food service included fruits, cheeses, tuna tartare, bacon mac n' cheese, and great mashed potatoes. There's an honor bar (you should pay for what you drink). Breakfast was similarly impressive. It rivals the full size buffet of many hotels--scrambled eggs, scrambled omelets, two kinds of sausage, bacon, hash browns, cold cuts, smoked salmon, cheese, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereal, lots of juices and so on. Really great food service here. Cons: The air conditioning is questionable. My room must have been 85 degrees when I checked in and was still at least 80 at midnight. I had a corner room on the 19th (highest) floor. It had two sets of large windows and only one inadequate air vent. The hotel engineer brought a Lasko box fan and poked the vents when I complained about the heat. Eventually, the hotel moved me to the 17th floor where the air conditioning was much better (this whole ordeal took about an hour between 11pm and midnight). It was 105 degrees outside when I checked in at 3pm. Rooms are "met expectations" for a 4 star hotel. The king room I originally had was spacious enough and almost junior suite like with its small work area separate from the bedroom. The bathrooms are small and have only a walk-in shower. The fixtures are average for a 4 star hotel (granite vanity, Restoration Hardware like fixtures). Really, the bathroom reminded me of a newer Westin (which I think is good). The work chairs on the Gold rooms are Herman Miller "Embody" chairs which are very ergonomic. In juxtaposition, the work table is too high to be ergonomic and the crossbeam supports underneath are routinely hitting my legs as I write this -- this is very annoying. Check-out at the Gold floor lounge was pleasant. The staff comped my parking ($22) and alcohol charges due to the inconvenience. I am undecided as to whether I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to do. . .”
Reviews.Author: sawsan22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean, yet, the surrounding area offers nothing. No decent restaurants, no night live, not even a bagel shop. Downtown Dallas shuts down at 4:00pm, you would have to drive good 30-45 minutes to go somewhere for dinner. Ghost town after 4pm. As for the hotel, they charge $7.50 for a bottle of water.... A 1/2 cup of fruits cost $17.95 WiFi is $24.99

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: mkcheather1
Reviews.Content: Great location, amazing service, all the extras and more! I always stay at the Fairmont Dallas hotel when I come to the Mary Kay Seminar/Convention each summer. Yes, it is crazy hot, but the hotel is always very comfortable. Incredible service - always attentive and goes the extra mile. I am there for Mary Kay, we have a formal night. I had a floor-length ball gown and it got horribly wrinkled during my travel to Dallas. The hotel staff were great, steamed my dress in a short amount of time and I was ready for the event looking great! The restaurants have great food, and great service. Love that there is an on-site Starbucks. Love the great selections for breakfasts/brunch and the elegant dinners! Since The rooms are well equipped, beds very comfortable. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: happyandfree2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay was the best! Greg at the front desk too such good care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay; elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkResident
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Saturday night in June. Had a suite on the 15th floor (Galveston Suite). Enormous room, 4 phones, 2 flat-screen TV sets, sofa & loveseat, full-size dining table, walk-in closet, marble bathroom. Staff was very helpful and efficient. Only glitch was valet parking when I was leaving Saturday night to meet friends at a restaurant. Called ahead from my room, 20 minutes before I was to leave, and it still took an additional 20 minutes of waiting in the heat before my car finally arrived; was late to the event as a result. Probably just a one-time thing; other times when I used this service they were very quick. The pool was wonderful, and pool-side dining was excellent. Also had room-service breakfast which was very elegant, delicious, and delivered promptly with style. The king-size bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Would love to return and stay again when I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, very dated hotel, air conditioning broke down in June...”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been here for years - nice bar, long term staff, nice helpful. This time back after 5 years, it really looked dated. The rooms are sizeable and reasonably appointed. Unfortunately for most of the first day of our meeting at the hotel, the air conditioning did not work. June, Dallas, 100+ degrees, not good. It took an age to get the air conditioning person in to fix - rumored to have been in Cancun for the weekend. This ok but its no longer a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - good stay - some issues with age”
Reviews.Author: LeaveFromPA
Reviews.Content: The Good: (1) Very pleasant and professional staff. From check in to check out - the bar, the restaurant, the valet, the housekeepers, etc - all are great. (2) The bar in the lobby is nice. The food is affordable and good. Careful what you ask for from the beer menu - they had none of the bottles listed on the menu that I asked for - and I asked for four different brews. (3) The room was spotless and cleaned well everyday. It is a bit annoying that I was out of my room from 8am to noon on most days and found my room not cleaned until after that often. Still, the housekeeping staff does a great job and I was impressed with their attention to detail. (4) Location is great. Easy walk to west end - many good places to eat - the art museum, the aquarium, other hotels, etc. Valet is expensive but only half what you'd pay in most East coast cities, so it is all relative. (5) Other guests all seem to be happy - evidence to me that they are enjoying their stay. The Not as Good: (1) The hotel is older - so while it is nice, it lacks some modern flair. The rooms are dated...again nice, with flat panel HD's, but the bathroom tub in my rooms struggled to drain. The air conditioning simply could not keep up with the 100+ degree sun beating on the windows all day. It was well into the evening until the room cooled off. Id recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing Concierge Floor”
Reviews.Author: rmeri
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for FIG. I upgraded to the concierge floor. My only complaint was that the hallways were very hot. The staff in the concierge lounge was so nice and the lounge was beautiful. The pool area was super nice and the staff constantly brought pitchers of cold ice water. So easy to get a shuttle to the airport, the GO shuttle is there every thirty minutes! LOVED THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Need to upgrade the elevators”
Reviews.Author: SKocurek
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if the hotel is full! The property doesn't have enough elevators and the existing elevators are small & slow. I don't like waiting in line for an elevator and I don't like my wife walking down 18 flights of stairs. I understand that elevator upgrades are expensive, but the hotel bills itself as a "luxury" hotel. Shame on management for letting this happen.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in a hotel that's a bit older than most”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights for a few business meetings and while I haven't stayed at many Fairmonts, I knew it was an upscale brand that should be comfortable. Pulling up to the building I had my doubtsâ€”the towers look like they were built in the 80sâ€”but once you get inside it's lovely. The FOOD is fantastic and the staff is some of the BEST out there. Three cheers for Donna in the Gold level lounge! (LOVE the honor bar, drinks, and food in there. Worth paying to stay on the Gold level. Also a nice spot for meetings with free internet.) The staff is VERY attentive and even a man delivering my room service added one of my dietary preferences to my client record for my next stay. And the house driver gave us a complimentary lift to Texas de Brazil (a great dinner out if you love meat!). My room was a suite and was nothing super fancy but nice and spacious and mostly modern.
