Loved the little kitchenette and having a fridge was handy. I do wish the room had more outlets. There is a lovely vanity area and I sat down to blowdry my hair and then discovered there was no outlet in that area at all. Caution: You WILL catch glimpses that will flash you back to 1989 in some places like old phones in the bathroom and an elevator that sometimes acts wonky. And I'm sorry but I can't STAND having to use my room key to access all floors in the elevator (not just the Gold floors). It's very inconvenient when you are carrying files or bags around. I doubt there is that much of a security risk at this hotel to warrant that. Fitness center is in basement but has nice, clean, modern equipment. I do wish they had a real spa. They can arrange services in your room, but I didn't want someone in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shacheb75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel and it was just a beautiful hotel. Everything is just exquisite. The food at the restaurant is very tasty and it is located in a wonderful. My boyfriend proposed to me at this hotel, so it definitely holds a very special place in my heart!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with a nice pool but expensive compared to the Adolphus which we preferred.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaHook_Hampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dallas for 3 nights recently - 2 at The Adolphus and 1 at The Fairmont. We enjoyed the pool at The Fairmont and the free uptown tourist trolley ride round the corner to the uptown restaurant area. The staff were good and it was clean and modern. However, we actually preferred The Adolphus in downtown which was cheaper too and nearer the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Fairmont standard”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, as we expected from the Fairmont brand! Room was elegantly appointed and we had quite a nice view of the city. Close to the West End, which was good for us because we went to the basketball, the JFK museum and the Butcher Shop Steakhouse, all of which were located there. Fantastic restaurant in the hotel, with exceptional service and great food. No free wi-fi in room, and business centre computers were slow but otherwise nothing bad to report.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LikeToTravel0
Reviews.Content: I should have reviewed this hotel before now. We booked through Travelocity. Upon check in we were offered a room upgrade to a Gold Club stay. It was only thirty dollars more per night per room. So for thirty bucks more a night, my husband an I got access to a concierge level that provided unlimited beverages, snacks, a lounge area, etc. It became our hang out with a group of 10 friends. We were able to have a continental breakfast each morning (it was a very good selection). We returned for snacks, appetizers, and night snacks all day long. Any time you wanted a beverage, it was right at your fingertips. A very good deal considering you would pay at least that to grab breakfast and lunch for two of us elsewhere. Hotel was very nice, very good rooms and in a good location to the downtown area to walk and find dinner. I liked the unlimited valet service that let you take your car out all day long without fees.

Reviews.Title: “if you value sleep - don't stay here horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: farela
Reviews.Content: the beds have no support you sink so low in them they must be the cheapest value beds on the planet. you actually roll towards the middle. horrible.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: andy8550
Reviews.Content: Even though this is a somewhat older property, it is magnificent. Convenient downtown location, albeit a $50 (w/tip) taxi to DFW. Also, no real "green" space in the area for running or walking. Nearly a mile and one-half to the nearest trail. Great morning buffet (but with the hefty price tag to accompany it). Restaurant staff referred to me by name, which is a nice touch. Excellent & Timely Room Service. Keurig coffee maker in the room was an added bonus. Check in was lightning fast -- less than a minute (probably closer to 30 seconds). The hotel was fully booked, but room was extraordinarily quiet (just some muted street noise since i was on a lower floor).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic !!!!”
Reviews.Author: djh2601
Reviews.Content: I am a very fussy hotel guest but the hotel was near perfect. I originally booked a one bed suite, as I am a member of their presidents club they have my preferences stored, within a couple of days of booking they contacted me to advise that all of their one bedroom suites connected to another room which I hate and is on my list of preferences they offered me several options non of which costing any more. I took the Gold floor option, a very nice room very modern ( which isnt my taste but very comfortable ) and a great view over Dallas. I explained to the manager of the gold floors what I wanted to do and within minutes of telling her she came back with maps and directions to the sites and attractions, even where the nearest drug store was because I had a headache !! Every time I went into the gold lounge she and her staff rememberd me be name, very impressive. Upon checking out the doorman asked me where I was travelling to when I said dallas love field airport he offered one of their sedan cars and he said that the cost was only two dollars more than a regular cab what a nice way to travel to the airport. My only slight let down was on my second night I thought that I would go down to the bar for a martini bet everywhere was full to bursting and very very noisy this is because the hotel has a lot of conference business, but that said i cannot reccomend this hotel more !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: cofjoy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed one night to attend a concert. From the valet staff, front office staff and wait service all was topnotch! Very friendly and very accommodating. We ate in the Lobby Bar and food was good. We had a room with 2 double beds. The bed was comfortable. I loved all the pillows and the linens. Bathroom shower was good and the bathroom was well lighted. I enjoyed my stay here very much. If you are planning to spend time in the arts district and Myerson Symphony Hall then the Fairmont is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..hotel needs to keep up with brand's quality.”
Reviews.Author: Nepsaevoli
Reviews.Content: Excellent VIP service upon check in. Love the President's Club benefits. But the room was below the Fairmont's standards from my perspective. Which is based on staying in several in the US and Canada. I went into it expecting too much, but brand expectations can do that. A few specifics, furnishings worn, messy grout, curtains worn and carpet spots. The hotel was channeling the 1990s. Early 1990s. Still, I'd recommend the hotel, but only based on location. PS. Free internet with membership in the Prez club. It's free to join.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Sniper33
Reviews.Content: This is a classic 4-star downtown hotel. The public areas are beautiful. The location is great for business or downtown sightseeing. It is close to Uptown and highways as well. Parking is expensive, but options other than valet are available esp. on the weekends. I had a non-Gold level suite. It was large but laid out differently from the pictures on the website. The bedroom was huge and the parlor area was smaller than pictured. The bathroom was very small but had high quality finishes. There was a huge walk-in closet. The mattress and bedding were fantastic. The decor is classic and high quality. It is not trendy, but I don't agree with others who say it is "dated" either. We had lots of privacy and quiet. We didn't interact much with the staff, but when we did, we found them polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great drinks at bar”
Reviews.Author: tiburonlatina
Reviews.Content: Our 5th wedding anniversary could not have been better. Great shower head, we had a view of the aa center. Which is about a $7 can ride from the hotel. Had drinks at the bar they were great hot wigs were hot but very very delicious. A bit pricy on drinks and food but one was enough. Well worth the try. Stayed only 1 night it has been the best hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay for a special anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jazzyforney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our anniversary and had a blast. We arrived to our room and there were rose petals all over the place,champagne,chocolate covered strawberries and much more. The price was excellent.The food in the restaurant was also good and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Suite...nothing sweet about it”
Reviews.Author: jrmcd52
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Fairmonts in Ariz and Canada I had high hopes for their Dallas location. Offered a suite at check-in for $100 additional and took it. I should have kept the original room. The living area of the suite were tattered and torn. Mis-matched furnishings simimlar to my college days and about that old. Cpmplained to front desk but was not offered any options. The bar and restaurants were very lively and service good as well as the food. Great pool but no service offered. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: robS101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times, and I must say I've never been disappointed in the staff. They are well trained, courteous, and prompt. The hotel is always clean and well organized, and the food is excellent. The only thing that I think would improve it would be some updating, as some of the rooms are looking a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bralossus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short weekend getaway and this was by far the best hotel that I've been too..The service was 2nd to none..Every aspect of this hotel is great from the beds to the bar!! Its location is also great..It is located next to many of Dallas's attractions..(Mckinney Ave., Historic West End, American Airlines Arena).

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenmarley36
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas this past July for business. The Fairmont was highly recommended. The hotel was great but a little outdated. The rooms could use some updating. I was able to spend some time by the pool which was great. The location of the hotel was perfect. A few steps from the hotel is an M-line stop. The M-Line is a free trolley service. I used it almost everyday to go to uptown. The service at the hotel was great. The only thing that I didn't really like about the hotel was its fancy restaurant. The food wasn't that great and it was very pricey. Overall when I go back to Dallas I am going to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bugs”
Reviews.Author: donnalovestraveling
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff leaves room service carts in the hallways overnight, so I guess it should be no surprise when a Texas-sized roach ran into my bathroom. Pretty grossed out and couldn't sleep that night. Location is convenient but cleanliness is more important.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: donnalovescheese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont for 2 nights. The location was fantastic and we found it easy to walk to all of Dallas' downtown attractions from her (6th floor museum, pioneer plaza, west end, etc.). More importantly we felt safe walking in the vicinity of the hotel at night which is something we hadn't felt at other locations in Dallas. The hotel itself was beautiful and felt very luxurious. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceeded in my stay at The Fairmont.”
Reviews.Author: JoeZimmy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were in Dallas for her work conference held at the Fairmont. I had high expectations based on the reviews I read and research that I did before arriving. I am happy to say that not only were my expectations met, they were exceeded from the moment we checked in until we checked out. We arrived around noon to check in and the woman at the check-in desk informed us that since they were still cleaning the rooms, our king bed room wasn't available at that time. She gave us the option of waiting or she could assign us a queen sized bed room. We decided to wait for the king and she took our cell number and promised to call as soon as the room was ready but then said "Let me check one more time" and found us a king room. She did all of this with a smile on her face and a great attitude. She also gave directions to local attractions and places to eat and was more than happy to answer our many questions. We arrived at the room, which was nestled in the corner of the hallway, and found the room to be clean and spacious. The bathroom was good sized but only one sink but since my fiance and I were on different schedules, that wasn't a problem for us, though it might be for other couples. A desk with two chairs was convenient as both of us brought our laptops and needed to work at the same time. A mini bar refrigerator and plamsa HD TV rounded out the room. Heading out to lunch, we encountered a doorman/bell hop that asked us if we needed help. That was the theme of our stay: all employees were pleasent extremely willing to help. He directed us to a great BBQ place and gave us tips for getting around Dallas. Overall, our stay was great. The bed was comfy, housekeeping did an excellent job keeping the room clean. The staff was helpful and available. The only complaint I have is that the prices for drinks at the gift shop were outrageous. Ten dollars for a water and soda. The drinks at the bar were pricey too but I expected that. However, those are minor complaints and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The hotel is close to the DART rail system, the West End district, the Kennedy Assassination site, American Airlines Arena and the Dallas Art Museum. There are several restaurants within walking distance as well so it is very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with exceptionally helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Francesca35
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is an elegant hotel with friendly and helpful, staff. The rooms are spacious and have extremely comfortable beds. There is a very nice terrace with swimming pool, shady seating areas and a herb garden - this was the highlight of the hotel for me - the perfect place to relax. The hotel is situated in the Downtown area of Dallas and is convenient for the Dart train and the McKinney Trolley - making visiting different areas of the city easy. The historic area and arts district are in easy walking distance - including the JFK museum which is well worth a visit. The hotel breakfast was quite expensive but the YMCA round the corner did a good burrito, freshly squeezed juice and delicious yoghurt smoothies. There is also a Starbucks on the corner of the hotel. There are few shops and cafes nearby because of the nature of the business area and this was the only slight downside to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: normychu
Reviews.Content: A friendly staff greeted us. The hotels was super clean and in a prime location of Dallas. Shopping and attractions were near the hotel and good food was all around. Soft pillows and a soft bed as well. I highly recommend The Fairmont Hotel. Price paid for 1 evening $130

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Drbackup
Reviews.Content: Great personal service and friendly staff. I would gladly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay except for the lounge...”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyls84
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice! It had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever had the pleasure of sleeping in. The only problem with this hotel was the waiting staff at the lounge, which I was basically forced to eat at due to lack of restaurants in the area. Every single time I ate at the restaurant, the wait staff did not get my order right. The people at the front desk were not really on top of things either. As we were to have a special group rate for our business conference. When we checked in they didn't even know what we were talking about. It was a lovely hotel but don't expect anyone who works there to know anything and order the simplest food that couldn't be screw up. Although they did screw up a hamburger and fries....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for the $79 rate. The room was non-descript, but had a very comfortable bed with quality linens. I also loved the large windows which ran the length of the outter wall. Our bathroom was small and did not contain a rubber mat to go in the tub, which I found very slippery. The common areas are nice, and I loved the pool area. The pool had lots of seating with drink service. It was also nice to walk through the herb garden. There did not seem to be many areas to sit in the lobby area other than the large open bar. I would stay there again if the price was right, but I don't think I would pay rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob1717
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights and was very satisfied. Location in walking distance to Sixth Floor Museum and various restaurants. Staff was great, very customer focused and helpful. Nice pool set up as well.

Reviews.Title: “FINE HOTEL IN DALLAS ARTS DISTRICT”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a fine hotel in downtown Dallas. Keep in mind that even thought you're in the so-called arts district, good restaurants are hard to come by and the hotel's Starbuck's has limited hours so nighttime repasts are a bit of a challenge. You can have nice bar food in the overly-lit hotel bar (the staff here is the hotel's weak link, with a somewhat attitudinal bar staff) The rooms are clean and comfortable (how I wish the windows would open, however!), ther terrace pool is clean and large and the staff is friendly and helpful. Overall, a fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: sf8717
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights and it was excellent. Good amenities are easy to find in hotels these days, good people are not....the staff at the Fairmont is wonderful. The views from our room on the 19th floor were amazing and the terrace pool is beautiful, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Special hotel AND a great location!”
Reviews.Author: txmasonmom
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel is absolutely wonderful! I visited for 1 night with my mother and my sister. As soon as we valeted the car and walked into the lobby, we were in heaven! It is a beautiful lobby and the service at check-in was wonderful. The lobby is very big and opulent; plush carpeting is throughout all the common areas on the first level. The bar area and Pyramid restaurant are right off the lobby. The terrace level includes a huge outdoor pool and garden area. It was all very lovely. The one flaw to this hotel that we found was no indoor or outdoor hot tub. We definitely were wanting to enjoy a relaxing night sitting in a hot tub and the cool pool (which is absolutely fabulous with 100 degree weather) wasn't inviting or relaxing at night with kids everywhere. Don't get me wrong, we love kids and left several at home with their dads for the night. This is definitely a kid-friendly hotel which is sometimes hard to find in a downtown location. The hotel room was wonderful, well appointed double room with a nice large desk, several lamps and reading chair. The bathroom was very nice with granite counters and rainshower shower head. The valet attendants were all very friendly and everytime I called for the car, the lady I spoke with on the phone was wonderful! The fountain place building next door to the The Fairmont has a lovely area to sit and enjoy especially with all the cypress trees and fountains! We visited the 6th floor museum and Dealey Plaza. The museum and surrounding area was an easy 5-6 blocks away along with all the restaurants in the West End. The Fairmont is now my go to hotel with I'm looking for a hotel in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, Front desk staff friendly, pool, and service was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: endless_summer1966
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I felt a bit overwhelmed, Old School Property, elegant and grand. Front office staff very friendly, had small issue with A/C eng dept came up to attempt to fix, front desk moved us to the other side the property quickly. Concierge staff attentive and helpful, and housekeeping was thoughtful. Enjoyed the stay, would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: AmyWasHere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting with a large group of colleagues. The rooms were clean and the bed and furniture were comfortable. I had a nice view of the city from the 18th floor. The meeting rooms were spacious and the food was good and had many healthy choices, which is unusual for a big meeting such as this. The hotel bar was nice and the bartenders were friendly and quick. I also enjoyed having a Starbucks in the lobby, which also featured friendly people. My only complaint was that unless in a public area, there was a charge for WiFi. Fortunately, by asking nicely the front desk clerk happily took the charges off my bill. I was surprised because a few months ago, I asked nicely at a Ritz Carlton for the same and was told, "no."

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced/Outdated”
Reviews.Author: gulfcoastgirls
Reviews.Content: I found the Fairmont to be a little long in the tooth. The lobby was cool but the upper floor hallways were hot and the room was about 78 degrees even though the thermostat was set on 70 when I entered. When I got to my room the first time, the key wasn't programmed so I had to return to the front desk once again. Forgot my hairspray so I thought I'd pick one up at the gift shop - $10.00 for a $.99 can of Aquanet! The room never cooled down and there was no fan in the room. Made for a long, hot night. The staff were friendly and very service oriented but within the first fifteen minutes, I had to tip the Head Valet, the Bell Boy and since I was not allowed to go to my car that was parked in the garage to get my laptop, I had to ask someone to get it and there went another tip. The restaurant was very overpriced, a breast of chicken with a 1/4c of lentils = $20 plus tax plus tip. Should have ordered a salad via room service as there really weren't a whole lot of options close by that I could see. The best part about this hotel is that it was a block and half away from my early morning appointment, other than that - not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for service”
Reviews.Author: mulerider
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont in Dallas a few years ago . My wife was in a pagent and it was there. Was given wrong room one bed for five people and they would not move us. Grease from the door hinges got all over one of the dresses and had to get nasty with the manager before they would dry clean it. When needing to go out to pick up odds and ends the staff had no clue as to how to get anywhere. The pool is located on the roof top which my kids liked but it stayed dirty all the time. Upon checking out the parking atendant gave me the keys to my car with the alarm device in three pices and all they said was sorry . If you like the glitz and overpaying for it this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property but those who work here need lessons on customer service!”
Reviews.Author: TNLZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property to attend a family function. We made advance reservations and made several inroom requests. On the day of checkin around 8pm i waited over 40 minutes for Eric and the manager in training to check me in. I was not off to a good start. I had a 7 week old baby that was needing to be fed and we waited in the lobby as a room was being found. I was very disappointed. To say the least my first 24 hours was filled with a very disappointing glitches and errors and problems. I requested a meeting with the hotel property's management.. I have to say Once I spoke with him he tried everything to make up for the bad experience. I really appreciate all his efforts and was able to enjoy the rest of my 4 nights at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: awrootbeer63
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at this hotel before but chose to stay there after receiving a special offer via e-mail. Our charge was $99/night incluing valet parking. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the most friendly staff and had an easy check in. The motel itself is centrally located to downtown and is convenient to many attractions including Stephen Pyles restaurant, the World Aquarium, The Museum of Art, Fair Park and nearby access to Interstate 45 which connects easily to the rest of Dallas. The room was clean, spacious with very nice accomodations and comfortable bed. The motel is absolutely gorgeous, with a focus on modern art for their lobby area and the pool area is breathtaking in the evening with all the lit up skyscrapers as your view. Lounge area is open to the lobby and has lots of activity without it being packed full of rowdy drunks. It was actually the first time I enjoyed the lounge at a hotel. The service was prompt, friendly and warm in all areas of the motel (including lounge). Just beware...since this is a beautiful motel numerous weddings and celebrations take place there. I am sure the reason we received such a discount is because there were five weddings and two graduation celebrations scheduled during our visit. However, the motel in general is very quiet on the room floors and the only inconvenience we experienced was at valet parking (they were very busy!). But patience and kindness goes along way and, eventually, service is provided by a very friendly staff. Or better yet, schedule your arrival/departure to accomodate. So before you stay, check on the scheduled events and get a discount if you can...paying less goes a long way in making a person more accomodating. In the end, I can't wait to go back...I've stayed at a lot of nice motels but the service at this one stands out and makes me want to return. This place actually has their customer in mind!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here, getting a bargain weekend rate. I was struck by how service-oriented the staff was (from the various concierges to the valets and bellmen). With the Fairmont name, I had been concerned that the overall feel would be formal and snooty. But it was totally the opposite, such that on the last night I made a special effort to express our gratitude to the night manager. Everybody was very friendly and engaging, and every question or issue that we had was dealt with expediently. Even a woman from the accounting department helped out when we were going to be late for a dinner reservation because our streetcar broke down. Our 17th floor room was fine, although in a few spots showed some aging. The elevator system works very well---even as far up as we were, we never had to wait long. The lobby area is elegant. The location is in the Arts District just a block or two from several major art museums, and within a 10 minute walk of the West End entertainment district and the downtown hub. There are many good restaurants nearby, or you can take the free streetcar a mile or so up to the trendy Uptown district. Another plus is that the hotel is easy to find and access if you're driving. Getting out of town is easy---just one block over and you're on an expressway. Parking is valet only, and we never had to wait for our car. The hotel's fitness room was just OK, but the outdoor pool area is very nice, a large area with lots of foliage. As expected, given the hotel's weekday corporate crowd, the prices in the hotel's restaurant were very high, but we never planned to eat there anyway. We ordered a glass of port one night in the bar, and all they had was one for $20 a glass---ridiculous! We passed. In addition to the restaurant, there is a Starbucks in the hotel, so you can get some muffins, coffee and juice (but no orange juice) there for breakfast. In summary, this hotel proves how important a positive, friendly attitude by the staff can be to the overall guest experience. Our experience with the Fairmont was great, and the special weekend rate we got was an incredible value..

Reviews.Title: “Where to Stay with Wife for 8 years of Marraige”
Reviews.Author: wescooling
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, checked into the hotel within minutes we had our card to get into room very quickly. Beautiful view of Downtown Dallas. We stayed in the North Tower. Had a bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival from the staff. Staff was very kind, helpful, and best customer service I have ever seen from a posh hotel possible. If you are on the fence between choosing this hotel over another chose the Fairmont you will not be sorry. Lastly, scored some huge points with the wife staying at this hotel. Customer service, fast service, nice hotel guest and staff, and great intangible products from the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that wants for nothing”
Reviews.Author: lindi3
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Very central to Dallas. Staff are incredibly friendly, helpful and knowledgable about the local area. Nothing was too much trouble. Rooms were well decorated and attractive, the beds big and comfortable. A beautiful terrace which is perfect for relaxation and allows great views of the city. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Pity they have theives working for them!”
Reviews.Author: MonsoonalBlue
Reviews.Content: The hotel to stay in was wonderful. My negative comments pertain to what happened afterwards. My 10 year old daughter left her bag behind in the room. On arriving in Washington we phoned the hotel to advise them of this. They had found her bag, but BIG SURPRISE - her camera, cash and Nintendo magically disappeared. Hotel was nice enough to forward what was left to Waldorf Astoria New York - thank you. The explanation was ordinary (including - staff are screened and checked blah, blah, blah). The fact is you have a theif working for you - and unless you install airport style xrays on your staffs baggage and person when leaving the hotel - don't kid yourself that it didn't happen - and I hope for future guests you have implemented some changes, because clearly whatever you are doing doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need some TLC”
Reviews.Author: Bastion123
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, right next to the trolley which we used a lot and within walking distance of many sites. Upon check-in we were charged an additional $50/night for a 'just-in-case' deposit...I've stayed at numerous other Fairmont properties and never had to provide an additional deposit, so keep that in mind when you are checking-in, but the front desk assured us that the $300 would be reversed from our credit card within a few weeks...thanks guys. When we got to our room, we noticed that the bathtub had what appeared to be blood/coffee/? splattered all over it! We were given another room but this didn't leave us with a good feeling. The room was a nice size and had a great view but things like the wallpaper peeling off, baseboards being full of dust and no fan in the bathroom causing a mold-like smell to be unleashed whenever you showered left a lot to be desired. The first night I had problems with my key. I went to the front desk to get it reset which, apparently they did, but it still didn't work. I went back down again to get a new card but instead was given a lesson on how to work a hotel swipe card and was told that security had to let me into my room and to go up to my room and wait by the door for them. After waiting a while, security finally came to let me in. They said that my card was faulty and needed to get a new card from front desk...this is what I wanted in the first place!!! Also has trouble with the tv...it wouldn't turn on. After a call to front desk and another lesson from them, this time on how to turn on a television the finally sent up their 'engineer' who dicovered that the cables had been unplugged from the back of the tv. The bell staff and concierge desk were the best part of the hotel...extremely helpful and knowledgable!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: We had a suite and it was fab! Great concierge by the name of Philip.

Reviews.Title: “Location is fantastic if you like walking to the Art Museums”
Reviews.Author: travelerstyle
Reviews.Content: We were only in town for a couple of days passing through and wanted to be close to the Dallas Museum of Art and the Nasher Sculputure Center which were both wonderful. The front desk staff not very friendly, however the bell staff was very efficient, accommodating and friendly. Dated bathroom such as small tubs and obsolete WC however very clean. Room service was a disappointment with both service and food lacking in taste and value for $100 dinner for myself and an 6-year-old. Upon checkout the doorman was friendly but service was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: H_SOHongKong
Reviews.Content: I needed to attend a conference at Dallas. Prior to the trip, I communicated with the hotel and its chef concierge did supply me valuable information regarding internet service and transportation to and from the airport. During my stay, the chef concierge helped me to collect my lost lugguage and booked a shuttle for my return trip. I am very satisfied with the staff service.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable bed and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cambridgecate
Reviews.Content: I went to the Fairmont for a conference and was very satisfied. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful from the second I arrived. There was not a hotel shuttle from the DFW airport and the front desk recommended an express shuttle that I never saw at the airport. Plan on taking a cab or driving to the hotel. The room was a decent size and it was clean. It had almost all of the amenities I needed including an iron, a hairdryer and a sizable desk. The desk chair left something to be desired and the extra charge for an internet connection seems odd at a conference hotel. I ordered room service for breakfast the first morning and it hit the spot. Even the healthy breakfast had generous portions although it should for the price. The conference food was also quite good for such large scale service. The view from the 4th floor was nonexistent, so request a higher floor if that is important to you. There was a bit of noise from the hall outside and housekeeping is persistant, so use that Do Not Disturb sign! The 4th floor terrace and swimming pool are a lovely spot to get some fresh air although it wasn't quite swimming weather. The best part of this hotel was the bed. Do not lay down if you are not planning on falling asleep immediately! I never sleep well, even at home. If there was a way to smuggle that bed home I would have done it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Upscale Hotel - Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: hotelcritic10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The rooms were spacious, clean, beautifully decorated...a wonderful room. Pillowtop mattress was comforatble and the pillows were nice, although the sheets were no very soft. The bathtub was on the shallow side for those interested in a long hot soak...ok, but not great. There was only one available plug in the desk area, a common problem. And the internet was not free - also a problem in my mind. The only other issue, is one that haunts every hotel on the market these days, which is the presence of LED lights which light up the room at night. The placement of these LEDs (smoke detectors only - no clock or thermostat LEDs here) wasn't that bad. But I was woken from a deep sleep and opened my eyes to stare into one. I have been in hotels where this is a major problem - just a minor one here. The location was very nice. A short walk to alot of restaurants and the art museum. Even though you are surrounded by office buildings, there is a lot of architecturally interesting things to see. For example there is a water park next door unlike anything I've ever seen in an office building city scape, and a nice little zen-like park right across the street where the sun streamed in late in the afternoon. It was March and warm in Dallas, and I came from cold and snowy PA, so getting to sit out and soak up a little sun was a nice thing. The breakfast buffet and meals from the menu were very good. And I had a banquet-style lunch at the conference I attended which a nicer banquet meal than I've ever had anywhere. The AA stadium and opera house are a short drive. If you want the perfect downtown hotel experience, this would be it for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: aesb0405
Reviews.Content: A Nice place to get away, it makes one feel pampered! I would never hesitate to stay at another Fairmont Hotel. It is very luxurious and well worth the money spent! They anticipate everything one would need such as offering massages, restaurants, gift shops, and postal services just to name a few.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: LilianaN1
Reviews.Content: perfect location high standard services. Good food also

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms a little out-dated.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Roo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel - Dallas for a sales meeting with my company. The hotel room itself was very cozy and a nice size. The bed was comfortable and the TV was a nice flatscreen. The one thing that seemed strange in this nice hotel room was the crummy bathroom. After waking up feeling like a mature adult, I ventured into the bathroom and had a time warp into my college days. The toilet looked like something that belonged in a public bathroom and the shower head reminded me of dorm showers - you need to block your skin so as not to get seared by the spray! Maybe I'm being picky but when you walk into a room where to unlock the door all you need to do is wave your key in front of the lock you would expect the bathroom to be a little more 'up to date'. All of that being said, the room service was prompt and tasty. The meeting rooms were very nice and the hotel was very accomodating for our extremely large group. Everything was in either walking distance or a short cab-ride away. One quick tip - become a member of the Fairmount President's Club to get free internet access while at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Humres32
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline for $97/night. Given what I paid, most of my experience was very good. The room was nice. We were close to the elevators so we could hear faint sounds constantly, but it was not imposing. The bathroom was a little small, but it was clean. The concierge was very helpful. He recommendend Y.O. Steakhouse where we had a good lunch and RJ's (Mexican) where we went to dinner one evening. I highly recommend RJ's! The food and drinks were fantastic. Other positives to this hotel -- it had a Starbuck's in the lobby and it is very close (about 5-6 blocks) to the West End where many restaurants reside. The West End is also where the 6th Floor Museum (aka The Book Depository) is located. We had an easy walk to the West End and also to the American Airlines arena to catch a hockey game. Ok...here is where I have to point out a MAJOR flaw of this hotel. The bar and its service were abysmal. We had to beg for service. We went there on 3 occasions and each time it was the same. One night the couple next to us got up and walked out without ordering anything because they were tired of waiting. One afternoon we were the only ones in the bar. We went up to the bar to order our drinks (we had learned our leason from the night before to not wait on them to come to you). We sat down at a table and enjoyed our drinks. Do you think the bartender checked on us even once? No. And when they are fairly busy (Fri/Sat nights) you are definitely better off going to the bar to get your drinks, otherwise, be prepared to wait. Although even getting your own drinks could be delayed. When we went to the bar one night and the service was also slow there, they tried to say they weren't supposed to give more than 3 drinks to a single customer. Ok...then get a good waitstaff! Also, their drinks are not cheap and the pours are not generous, so if you can go somewhere else for drinks, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethM6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and has all the amenities you could ever want. The service is exemplary. The location is convenient and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “To Be Expected”
Reviews.Author: MachitaMeg
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean. The lobby was beautiful and a starbucks right off the lobby. Would recommend. Very busy w/conferences though

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE YET!!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and we had the best experience. The price was excellent and the service we received was even better. We stayed at one of their gold rooms and from the moment we arrived we were treated especially well. We also had dinner at the pyramid restaurant (at the hotel) and again, received the best treatment! We will defiantly be staying there again, anytime we are in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor for a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: BusyBizTraveler20
Reviews.Content: 1. Missed wake-up calls 2. Missed package delivery 3. Banging plumbing 4. Indifferent/Surly Front Desk Staff and Night Operators 5. Food quality on Thanksgiving Buffet was just so-so and service was slow 6. Internet is $15.10 a night - outrageous! and worse,their internal internet server flashes a toolbar on your screen every time you open a new page 7. Parking is $21.00 per night 8. Restaurant staff tried to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: Mostly positive two-night stay at the Fairmont. Great downtown location was within easy walking distance to the West End. Particularly enjoyed the bouncy carpet and great bed. Common areas nice but did not visit the in-lobby bar or restaurant. Efficient elevators. Quick response and follow-up when my tv had audio but no video. Nice bath products. $7.50 bottled water in room was a joke. Missed a bath fan-my pet peeve. Also searched on site and adjoining local area for local newspaper but none to be found. Concierge desk not staffed when I could have used it. Did reach behind desk for area map. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip. Overall nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Member_Too
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, 11 years to the day of our wedding. I tried to get the same room. They did their best to accomodate us, but there was en error on my part on the room number (not the name of the suite), and we ended up on the opposite side. They were very nice and tried, but our room was already booked. Awwwww. This hotel is very nice for an older hotel and is very close to major attractions in the heart of downtown. Walking distance to the arts district, close to West End and American Airlines Center/Victory Park, etc. The rooms while being older are nicely appointed. The suites have small bathrooms! The Terrace Level pool and herb garden is a nice touch. A (relatively) calm haven in the busy city. Be advised that it is close to a highway, so you may hear traffic noises, sirens from a fire station a couple blocks away, etc. The lobby areas are nice and the Pyramid Grill was nice the last time we were there a few years ago. Valet service was prompt and courteous. All in all, it was a good stay and nice to be back there after all those years. Maybe we will return and try again for the 15 or 20 year!!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont very pleasant & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NYnyvisitor
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Fairmont and found it very pleasant and comfortable. It is rather like a very nice old-fashioned hotel in ambience, with modern amenities. Our room was very good, with expansive view. The only particularly disappointing thing was breakfast in dining room: buffet food was cold, stale and pretty tasteless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: So I stayed here for a weekend night with some friends. The lobby was nice and quite impressive but the room wasn't that clean and the hallway was in need of some serious renovations. The pool was fantastic. with a great view of the city The location was excellent. I some how got a fantastic deal on the hotel off the Fairmont website as a AAA member - $89. It was overall a nice stay and the bath robes were a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but pricey”
Reviews.Author: loldreamlove
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Fairmont. One thing though, be sure to have backup cash after checkout. The minibar in the room is super pricey. On top of that WiFi is not free. It's 13.00 for 24 hours. Most cheaper chained hotels have free WiFi and with the price of the rooms, WiFi SHOULD be included. On their website, it's listed as being available but they do not tell you it's free. The Pyramid bar and restaurant in the hotel is not very good for the price. I would recommend this hotel if money was not an option. Otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location downtown”
Reviews.Author: mbar2009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fairmonts all over the US. This one is one of the older Fairmonts, but still very nice. We had a suite which was definitely very spacious. We notified the front desk that it was our anniversary prior to arrival, and we were greated wtih a lovely dessert sampler with Happy Anniversary written in chocolate. That was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn nice, especially if you get one of the updated/bigger rooms”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont three times in the past three months. Once I got a kind of tired room in the south tower. The second time I got a club level room in the north tower (verrry nice). The third time I got what looked like an updated room in the south tower. Things I like: the first and third rooms; the club lounge food, drink , and kind hostesses; the fact the bellmen and front desk staff remembered me on my third visit; the lobby was a comfortable place to wait to meet people or just to hang out and read; room service got my food to me quickly, and it was tasty and hot; the mini-bar is well-stocked; the bed and bedding were very comfortable and nice quality-feeling; bathroom is good-sized and the towels are above-average; the wireless was easy to access; nice TVs; the bartenders were super-nice, one even made me a glass of lemonade from scratch (it was outstanding!). Things that were misses. The "business center" is incredibly over-priced ($30 to receive a small UPS box that held two binders, and then the shipping people took forever to bring it, finally the cashier in the business center went to get it). I think the restaurant menu could be a little broader, and that the breakfast buffet is ok, but could have more variety and be presented more attractively; after 10 pm or so, if you call room service, you get the hotel operator, who then has room service personnel call you back. My room had some sort of ventilation thing that I couldn't control, so there was quite a bit of white noise; it didn't bother me, but light sleepers probably would not like it. On balance, I think this hotel has a lot of good qualities, and I was very comfortable staying here, especially when I had the nicer rooms. The first visit was a little underwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for upper end hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jerryedw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Fairmont three times in the last 2 months. I compared prices at other hotels (Mansion on Turtle Creek, Ritz Carlton) and found prices to be half as much. Stayed in the "Gold" rooms with complimentary club room. Over all an outstanding value. Only negative was the restaurant (Pyramid) which was substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boborr
Reviews.Content: We visited Dallas for the Paul McCartney concert and stayed at the Fairmont. Would go back again,rooms were clean,service was good. Good lounge area,drinks very pricey though,not a surprise given it is a downtown hotel.Pool area was great,it was clean,good after a day around town. Very comfortable bed too. Maybe the only issue was the air conditioner was a little loud at night,but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure house keeping doesnt make calls from your room!!”
Reviews.Author: vonooca
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hotel untill i checked out and went to work. I noticed the one day I let house keeping in to clean someone had made a phone call from my room. This was the first time I traveled for work so I glanced at my bill and made sure i had all my reciepts. Ive learned a lesson for that I thank you .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mrchunky
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 'gold floor' as Fairmont Executive Club members. Great breakfast area although slightly standard fare to be had - nice at night to be able to go for a pre-dinner drink there with a tv and a selection of beers, wine etc. Honour bar in operation which was a great touch. Friendly and efficient staff. Bar downstairs a pretty typical hotel bar - stopped serving fairly early though after we had been promised a late license. Room a good size and well laid out. Nespresso coffee machine and Ihome docs for music was a nice touch. Pool area a bit dated and service out there almost non-existent - I had to find a phone on two occasions (in 3 days) to call to ask for someone to stop by. Nice staff though for the most part.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Downtown Dallas, Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: tinsel57
Reviews.Content: I was excited about our weekend trip to Dallas, My 25 year old daughter had purchased concert tickets for me as a Mother's Day gift. I thought I would treat her to a night at the Fairmont. Being a travel agent I love the opportunity to preview hotels so that I might add them to my arsenal of suggestions to my clients. I was looking forward to seeing what the Fairmont had to offer. Though the Dallas traffic and bumpy roads are never delightful, the location of the Fairmont offers easy access to major interstates and many downtown options. As expected, there's no parking at the hotel itself but you can find parking garages within walking distance, or, as many do, use the valet system at a cost of $21 per night. It's just plain easier and if you're a woman alone, especially traveling at night, this might be the suggested option. Car drop off didn't take long and we wheeled our small bags into the lobby. It's less than grand, looking slightly dated but we pressed on. We received a lovely warm welcome at reception and in no time were on our way to the 15th floor to our room. The room overall, was nothing to write home about. Drab. But I had expected this. They rarely give travel agents the best room in the house. Great view with really fabulous window darkening curtains that really do work. The highlight was the bed. One of the most comfortable I have ever had. High marks here. Granite top night stands. A LG flat panel TV which was not functioning. Turned out the cord had been pulled from the set itself but they sent someone up to fix it right away. Three phones, one on the desk, one on the nightstand, one in the bathroom. Just incase you can't walk three feet to reach a phone, I guess! There is a small coffee pot with choice of regular or decaff and a few tea bags. A huge locked honor bar where A rice crispy treat was $3.75. Fiji water, $7.50 a bottle. Not having time to run around looking for places to eat, we ordered room service. A simple meal, hamburger and chicken roll up, both came with french fries and a pickle. This was delivered on a cart, not tray, and rolled into our room. Very nice service at a cost of $47, with ice water to drink. Morning brought quick check out and the bag boy collected my bags from reception while the concierge desk printed out my directions to find my way back onto the interstate. Our car was waiting bags were loaded and off we went. It wasn't until I returned home that I noted one bag was missing. It was a small canvass monogrammed tote that luckily, contained nothing of value however, the bag was brand new and I really wanted it back! A call to the Fairmont proved fruitless. No one located my bag, which would have easily stood out in the crowd. Nothing was found in lost and found, nothing at the bell station. Somewhat disappointing but not a huge loss. Would I stay again? Yes, but mainly because I get a Travel Agent's discount and the price I pay is an exceptional value. It's not the Fairmont of San Fran or Hawaii and while the staff tries very hard, there's just something off the mark here for a Fairmont. I had expected more because it's a Fairmont. That being said, the location is excellent, the rooms are very clean, the bed exceptionally comfortable. Staff was accommodating and very polite. It just needs the Fairmont Wow! makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Solid location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Pecksonthego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a quick trip in Dallas over the fourth. We enjoyed the hotel with a great rate ($90) for the slow weekend. Had a couple good martinis in the hotel lobby bar. The workout room had recent cardio and weight machines. Small details such as a ceiling panel missing in an elevator and a plastic coating on a ceramic tub were very minor. $21 dollar a day valet seemed a little steep.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: BostonArmywife
Reviews.Content: While not the nicest hotel we've ever stayed in, they pay attention to the details which is what made our stay such a nice one. Little things like super comfy beds, nice sheets, great water pressure in the shower, robes, HUGE rooms in our suite, water pitchers poolside, are just a few of the things that we enjoyed and we've missed at some hotels despite a higher price tag and star rating. Some of the decor was a little outdated, but it was classy and not tacky in any way, and it certainly didn't affect the things that matter most to us. The pool is great - much bigger than some we've seen in major cities which allows you to find a quiet corner even if there are rowdy kids splashing around but it's not open year round so check with them first. Some reviews commented on the staff but we had very little contact with them which is just the way we like it. They were there (and very accommodating) when we needed them but not in our faces. The location is perfect if you're interested in the JFK stuff, Market Street restaurants, and the arts district, as well as some of the nicer restaurants. Valet parking is a little steep considering you can park in any of the local lots for $5 a day as compared to $21 at the hotel but at least we knew our car was safe. We'd definitely stay here again, and we'd probably stay in a suite again although we certainly didn't need all that room .

Reviews.Title: “Stay on a GOLD Floor”
Reviews.Author: PDXStocks
Reviews.Content: Having read some previous reviews, we stayed on a newly remodeled Gold floor. Our rate was $139 and we also belong to the Fairmont President's Club. The rooms are well appointed and updated in a neutral tones. We had a corner king room with excellent views in two directions. The food presentations in the club lounge are excellent and second only to the Ritz in quality. The club rooms at other hotels nearby are nowhere near the quality of the Fairmont. The restaurant Pyramid is very well reviewed in the Dallas Press and currently running a four course $40 prix fixe menu to celebrate the Fairmont 40th Anniversary. It's a wonderful offer. The Fairmont has an excellent and quite large gym along with a large outdoor pool. Given their normal rates, it pays to do a little shopping online for specials which are easily had in this economy. We enjoyed the rooms, our incredible bath robes, free internet, soft down pillows etc. It's all a lovely experience. There is twice daily maid service and with one phone call we had anything we requested without waiting any longer than 5 minutes. Very impressive. We were surprised by how quickly the valets had the car each time we called, even with the hotel being quite full and handling three weddings that we counted. Don't worry about the previous people who seemed to have numerous complaints for one wrong or the other, we did not experience anything close to these experiences and again, I would do a little a shopping online and definitely book a Gold level floor it is well worth the extra amount you'll pay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to updated.....”
Reviews.Author: ajjl57
Reviews.Content: I'd pass. Really looks like it needs an overhaul. Pool was not yet open. Our suiyte was large but the decor is old and dingy looking. NOT a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is about service--not here”
Reviews.Author: teachlaw1
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible time with the valet at this hotel. The comment was made that they did not know if I was coming or going. My response was, does it matter? The hotel was fantastic. The room was great and the hotel was wonderful. Call before you go, we went looking forward to a great afternoon at the pool. No one said anything about the fact that it was drained and not a single pool chair or chaise to be found. Disappointed my son a great deal. Would stay here again, but would make sure that I called and asked if the hotel was providing full service.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in nicer Holiday Inns!”
Reviews.Author: duckfisney
Reviews.Content: Second buisness trip to Fairmont Dallas in 3 weeks, both stays were bad. First stay room OK but awakened by engineering pounding on something in the hallway at 7am! complaints to front desk did no good. Also Valet parking was terrible took about 45 minutes to get my car after calling 20 minutes ahead! Come on people some of us have to get to work! Current trip I am in 4th room to finally get something marginally acceptable. First room had bad mildew stench, set my allergies off just opening the door, actually just getting off the elevator. the whole south 4th floor smells bad. Second room had a big wad of tissue like a spitball stuck to the wall by the bathroom, yellow water in the toilet and lots of missing towels. The third room had unbelievably a huge cigarette burn, ON THE BATHTUB! There were actually many burn and melt marks in the tub! Nice! My request to get a manager to come to my room and look at the tub were ignored but the front desk took me on a tour of available rooms to find clean one. Some luxury hotel. I stay in hotels usually 230 to 260 nights a year, I have rarely seen hotels in such run down condition. Maybe I have been lucky for the last 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Experience”
Reviews.Author: mmurarka
Reviews.Content: Really great experience. Room, Staff, Location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessEthel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference at the Fairmont. The staff were very professional and acknowledged me even when just passing in the hall or lobby. Very easy check in and out. The bed was comfortable, spacious and clean. There were some signs of aging in the bathroom and it certainly could use a new showerhead. I got a great promotional rate so the price was right. The conference facilities were also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, I would absolutely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jpw62
Reviews.Content: I just got back to Boston from Dallas today and as tired as I am, I wanted to write this review. I am VERY picky person when it comes to cleanliness and safety and The Fairmont is a pretty nice hotel, the room I was in (King bed) was a good size fairly update and there was a few dumb things like the pool being drained and re-tiled, flat panel tv was nice, and the room was clean- except I have to be honest, they do need to vacuum around the bed frame legs... anyhow I always wear slippers, but, it was clean, the bed had failry crisp white down feather pillows and blankets, in another review someone complained about the throw at the end of the bed being dirty, I think its the fabric that makes it appear that way...crushed velvet type of fabric. Anyhow, I went to the Hyatt at Reunion Blvd, where my colleagues where staying and it was nasty- the rooms were old and dated, and a street person was roaming the lobby asking for money! The Fairmont is really safe, they dont even allow pizza delivery people up to the rooms, you have to come down to get it. The bellman is an older man and the valet guy as well, both are really helpful and awesome! Checking in was a breeze, but make sure you check your itemized bill, they accidently charged me for 1 day of parking @ $21.00- I called the desk and it was taken care of before I checked out... Check out was so simple, no waiting at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown/Arts District location”
Reviews.Author: Austini
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Dallas has an excellent location for the downtown Arts District; 1 block to the Dallas Museum of Art (with, for a few more weeks, the traveling Tut exhibit), 2 blocks to the Nasher Sculpture Center, 2 blocks to the Crow Collection of Asian Art, 1 block to the McKinney Ave. Trolley, just a few blocks to the Dart rail line, and a few blocks to Thanks-Giving Square with its interesting chapel. We got an extremely good, online-only rate of under $100-a-night for a deluxe king room on the Fairmont Web site (one slightly scary catch: it was a pay-in-advance, nonrefundable rate; fortunately, we didn't get ill or otherwise have to cancel our trip, so it did work out perfectly for us, but it still made me a bit nervous). The room was large, well furnished and had a nice downtown view (we could see Dallas' famous, old Mobil Pegasus neon sign from our window). You could find a few little signs of normal wear-and-tear in some of the furniture and fixtures, particularly in the bathroom, but nothing that in any way detracted from our comfort or enjoyment of the room. Might be just enough to disappoint someone heavily fixated on a utterly immaculate 5-star luxury hotel experience, though. The valet parking is a notable extra expense at $21 per day. While I naturally would like free parking, I do understand that this is downtown Dallas and parking is at a premium. What bugged me far more than having to pay extra for parking is that it was valet-only and we weren't given ready access to our car. So, just to fetch something out of the glovebox of the car required going through the valets with an additional 10-15 min. wait (could grow to 20 mins. at really busy times) for them to bring the car around, along with the polite but clear expectation from the valet of a small tip. Quite a substantial inconvenience; I vastly prefer self parking, whether it's paid or free. One other minor annoyance is that the rooms, even the deluxe kings, don't come with mini-fridges. Mini-fridges are available, but only for an additional $25 (that is per stay, thankfully, rather than a per-night charge). Our room would've had plenty of space to inconspicuously place a mini-fridge. Probably a minor item for many travelers, but I must say that it definitely struck me as rather chintzy that a luxury hotel like the Fairmont didn't have as standard an amenity that's now pretty much expected in your average Comfort Inns and Best Westerns. One tip: It's a good idea to go to the Fairmont Web site and join their free "President's Club" loyalty program, ideally before making your reservation. As a "President's Club" member, you get free in-room Internet access and free local calls, plus expedited check-in and check-out. Since there's no charge to join, it's definitely worth the few minutes it takes to sign up.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont is AMAZING!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: charlieswife17
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a weekend get-a-way to the Fairmont in Dallas, TX. We were in Dallas to see the King Tut exhibit, which was amazing! The Fairmont is just two blocks from the Dallas Art Museum so it was easy access to get there. We had planned to stay two nights, but unfortunately, I became very ill and we decided to check out early. We checked out at 4 pm on Saturday and we were not charged for that night at all!! The staff was awesome and completely helpful. The rooms were beautiful and very comfortable. This was an EXTREMELY nice hotel but we booked via Travel Zoo and got an amazing rate! I can not recommend The Fairmont more!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised....is an understatment”
Reviews.Author: COBDallas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for a night as his birthday gift. After being charged $21 just to park, we walked into a very dingy and musty room. There were stains on the throw blanket and the room was nothing like the picture on the website. After speaking with the consierge the day before, I was promised the highest floor available with a good view, but we ended up staying on the 7th floor overlooking a parking garage. In the hotel's defense, I did request a smoking room, so I am sure that is where most of the dinginess and smell came from, but it was overpowering. We had tickets to the Mavs game that night at the American Airlines Center and it was an easy walk from the hotel. We chose to hang out at a local restarant for most of the night after the game to avoid having to come back to the room! It was pretty embarrassing and not at all romantic, to say the least. Again, in the hotel's defense, I did not call and request a room change or housekeeping, had I done so, the hotel probably would have been able to help. The hotel staff is very nice and courteous. I will definitely stick to hotels I know in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: IRISHdjt
Reviews.Content: Gave me a room with 2 double beds even though I booked a king bed. A/C would not cool the room. TV remote did not work. Bathroom flooded when showering. Staff was abrupt and rude. Valet service was incredibly slow.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here if you don't like beds that are hard as rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: dlr25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel as a weekend getaway. It was the first time we have been away in quite some time since having our young son. We were really looking forward to spending Valentine's at the Fairmont. The hotel is nice. Ambience is nice. Hotel bar was great. They put us in a quiet area as we requested. BUT THE BED WAS AWFUL. I mean dreadful. It was like a rock with no give. My back hurt so badly. I barely slept the second night. AND, they charged $13.95 for internet usage. AND, parking was $21 per night for guests. AND, they tried to charge me for in-room dining service to deliver chocolate covered strawberries and truffles that were placed in my room BEFORE we checked in and that were part of the Valentine's promotion that we got. Thank goodness the restaurants we ate at (not the hotel restaurant) were awesome. We will not be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Visited Dallas for the Cotton Bowl”
Reviews.Author: tnoccther
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at full capacity due to mostly Ole Miss fans in town for Cotton Bowl. Checked in at 5:00 p.m. and had to wait an hour for room to be readied, Manager knocked about 25% off rate for both nights' stay. Have stayed at this hotel 4-5 times in last few years, and never come away disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Big Room”
Reviews.Author: mattmc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont was almost perfect. The staff were the most courteous and helpful of any hotel at which we've stayed. The concierge gave great recommendations on dining and things to do in the area and check in and out was smooth and easy. The room (a standard room with two queen beds) was much larger than rooms at comparably priced hotels and we really enjoyed a relaxing time. Two reasons prohibit me from giving this hotel 5 stars. (I won't even mention the $21 a night parking. I realize that this is the case pretty much anywhere, but it's highway robbery. At least the valet service was excellent and efficient). First of all - why charge for high speed internet when you're already getting $120 for the room (not counting parking)? That seems a bit greedy and unnecesary. Secondly, they charged me for a local phone call! It only amounted to fifty cents, but still. In a hotel this nice and service oriented you would think that internet and local calls should be included. Overall though - this was a great stay, we fully intend to return, and heartily recommend the Fairmont to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Staff & Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: patrickstpaul
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Fairmont during the holiday season and although the hotel lobby had a lot of activity and the entrance was packed with cars and valets (you can only valet your car at this property â€“ about $21/day), the staff was friendly, professional and calm and check-in was quick. My room was in the South Tower and if you overlook the garish hot-pinkish door, youâ€™ll appreciate the neutral ambiance of the rather large room with excellent workspace and very comfortable bed. There is a well-equipped exercise room on the level below the lobby and had the weather been warmer, I would really have enjoyed the beautiful terrace-level (select â€˜Tâ€™ in the elevator to get to the pool) swimming pool and gardens. I imagine this hotel pool is the perfect summer retreat in Dallas. We spent the evening in the Cedar Springs/Throckmorton area of Dallas and it was only a $10-$12 cab ride about 2 miles away (you have to pay a $4 fuel charge â€“ in Dallas? When gas is $1.60? anywayâ€¦) and it was easy to get a cab to and from the hotel. I would stay at this property again and recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in the downtown area. Also, if you have the time, rent a car and drive over to Fort Worth â€“ especially during the holiday season. The stockyard area was decorated for the holidays and had lots of interesting shops/restaurants to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay again”
Reviews.Author: dnjscheer
Reviews.Content: We booked an air/hotel package through Travelocity with the purpose of seeing the King Tut exhibit at the Dallas Museum. Booked a regular King room and were pleased and surprised at check-in to be upgraded to a suite. The desk agent told us that he "didn't have any King bed rooms left" so was upgrading us to a king suite. Strange as the bartender later told us they were only at 12% capacity and we never saw a single other guest on our south tower elevators in 3 days. Hey, no complaints! The suite is wonderful. Nice walk in closet, sofas (one pulls out) and eating table in the sitting room with flat screen tv, large desk and sitting table in the bedroom with another large flat screen. The only complaint is with the design of the bathroom where the door nearly hits the toilet. You'd think that in the design of a suite they could've found another couple of feet to steal from the bedroom to make the bath more comfortable. Still, this is NOT a big deal. Service was incredible throughout. Very nice concierges who were helpful as was the rest of the staff. The bar never had more than 4 other guests in it. They told us that this is the low season for their main business which is conventions. Maybe that's why it was so nice and quiet. We were a little grumpy about the nickel and dime-ing that happens with the internet service. $13.95 to connect (wireless or wired) in the room. Then because I don't have a printer, I had to use the hotel's business center to print our boarding passes -- another $7.99 for those 6 minutes. At the price per night, I'd expect this to be less. The restaurant is one block from the museums which was perfect for us, and one block from the free McKinney Ave Trolley which can take you uptown a bit to more restaurants and shopping. The downtown area where the hotel is has zero restaurants for breakfast that we could find. If you don't mind walking, there are several good restaurants within about 1/2 mile. The very pricey but excellent Stephan Pyles is one block away. The Dallas Fish Market is also great (about 1/2 mile). We also walked to the JFK museum, about 3/4 mi. I think, and on the way the Village Corner Bakery is a good breakfast spot. We did this trip without a rental car which is doable but ONLY if you like/don't mind walking...a lot...for everything. This area has little but office buildings. We would stay here again for the service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time!”
Reviews.Author: clkc86
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Fairmont. The level of service here is excellent. This stay we booked a Gold level room and felt it was really worth it. We had a corner room that was very nicely decorated in a more contemporary style than the room on our first stay. The bathroom door wasn't typical, it was more like a pocket door. There was a HUGE shower that was very enjoyable. The bathroom also had a makeup mirror, which I missed in the "regular" room. Still had a big walk in closet. The evening appetizers and morning breakfast were nice. Drinks are available but not included in the price of the room. We enjoyed the in room Nespresso machine as well as the one in the lounge. Before our trip I emailed the hotel for restaurant ideas. The concierge staff responded quickly and very professionally to our requests. They made all our dinner reservations for us, so we had no worries about where to go for dinner. We had one dinner in the hotel's Pyramid restaurant. The service was outstanding. The wine steward was a great help and provided some great information. My husband thought the filet he had for dinner was one of the best ever. My lamb needed a bit of work, but was cooked as I ordered. We shared a charcuterie appetizer and it was a good choice. We didn't order a dessert as the hotel had delivered a pice of cake to our room to celebrate my birthday. Every staff person at this hotel greeted us warmly, and it didn't seem forced as I would have expected. The housekeeping staff left me a thank you note for leaving a dollar tip on the bed every morning and evening. It's hard to find any real problems at this hotel. It is an older property, but the service is more than enough to make up for that. I will certainly stay here again and I will book the Gold room for future stays as well. Thank you Fairmont Dallas!!

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay at the Fairmont!”
Reviews.Author: FriarBri
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Not sure where to begin because everything was superb. Great location within walking distance of many places. Right around the corner is the fantastic restaurant Stephan Pyles. JFK Museum just a 10-minute walk, as is the entire Historic District with many other restaurants. The staff here goes out of their way to welcome you and greet you every day, from Front Desk people to Housekeeping, etc. The rooms are spotless and well appointed. The beds are so comfortable you might not want to get up in the morning! The hotel bar and restaurant, Pyramid, has great food for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Or if you'd rather like something light there is a Starbucks off the lobby to get a coffee and pastry in the morning. I honestly cannot think of anything that was negative. I would not stay anywhere else in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dukekit
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice 4 day stay. The hotel is older and if you look closely you'll notice a few nicks and scratches around, but generally nice facilities. Everyone was very nice - front desk, reception, concierge, valet, housekeeping, bar. I was very impressed with the consistently friendly service. Oh, one complaint was the low-flow showerhead. Yuck. But what do I know, maybe Dallas is having a drought. The aquarium was an easy walk (2 or 3 blocks) and was great. The West End neighborhood was also an easy walk and had lots of restaurant options (lot of steakhouses, no surprise, but some other options too). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: j'smomTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while attending a conference at the Dallas Convention Center. I was very satisfied with my choice. The service at this hotel is top-notch. My room was very nice â€“ my favorite part was the large walk-in closet. Inside this big closet was an oversized safe that fit both my camcorder in its bag and my camera. The TV was a large flat screen. The bathroom was a little small and the tub and toilet could be updated, but the vanity was very nice. There were two plush robes available to use. I had to call the front desk right after I arrived to report a problem with the toilet flushing properly and someone arrived in less than 10 minutes. Housekeeping did an outstanding job, room service was good, and the concierge was always very helpful. The buffet breakfast was very good, although it lacked a good selection of fresh fruit. I have only two minor complaints about the room. At night you can hear the elevator running. If you sleep lightly as I do, it may bother you at first. I did get used to it. The room only had one electrical outlet that I could access. When I needed to use the iron or recharge my cell phone, etc., I had to get down on my hands and knees and crawl under the desk to plug it in. This hotel is within walking distance to many things, including the Plaza of the Americas, the Dallas Museum of Art, the Dallas World Aquarium, the West End, and the Sixth Floor Museum. I got a special rate of $155 per night and it was definitely a good price. I do think I would be hesitant to pay the rack rate of $300-$400. I only say this because the room is nice but not especially luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-great beds”
Reviews.Author: neicie
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal through Hotwire for Texas/ou weekend. the hotel is in a great location-only a few blocks from West End and Victory Park. The lobby was very nice with a relaxing atmosphere in the bar area. we didn't use the pool, but we had a great view of it from our room and it looked nice. The bed was one of the best i have ever slept in. The only downside was parking was $21. that is a bit steep in my opinion. I would stay there again if i needed a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Dallas - the BEST luxury hotel in town!”
Reviews.Author: travelbound28
Reviews.Content: Booked one of their new Fairmont Gold Suites via Expedia.com, and was a little worried if the pictures and descriptions were 'too good to be true', but we felt the rate was appropriate for a club level - type suite at a luxury hotel (around $400/night).
